Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas de calidad, líquidos para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le ayudará a mejorar la calidad del producto.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa para poder vivir ahí con la familia y no estar preocupado pagar el arriendo.
Los desafíos a los que se presenta a diario son los intermediarios, la competencia, las plagas en los cultivos.
En los tiempos libres le guata estar con la familia y poder disfrutar de las festividades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Jeny Joansa is 41, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and her children, ages 15 and 20, in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  The "Vuelve la Esperanza" communal bank is made up 13 members, and is located in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the branch office. 

Jeny is a farmer, and grows corn, soy beans, cacao and plantains. She carries out her purchases and sales in San José del Tambo, every weekend. She is applying for the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, quality seeds, and herbicides in order to maintain her crops in good condtion and sell them at a good price. 

The loan will be a great help to her, because it will help her improve the quality of her product.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house for herself and her family to live in, and not worry about paying rent. The challenges that arise daily are  competition, dealing with middlemen, and crop pests. In her free time she likes to be with her family and enjoy local festivals.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers, quality seeds, and herbicides in order to maintain her crops in good condition, and later sell them at a good price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi, and also fish to stock his business.

loans.name: Maira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maira de 28 años de edad, es soltera,  vive junto a sus padres en su casa, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 4 años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad él solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  a sus padres.

Maira observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Maira es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores comodidades a sus padres en la casa que viven.
texts.en:
Maira, 28, is single living with her parents in their house which has electricity and running water and is located in the urban part of Paijan District which belongs to La Libertad Department.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

She’s had a home-based grocery store for four years.  She sells basic staple items and groceries in general to her neighbors and local customers.  She has an established clientele and no other nearby competition.  She is able to cover her expenses and help her parents with this business.

Maira observes that her business is growing favorably and wants to continue expanding it buying more merchandise like foodstuffs and groceries in general.  To do so, she’s felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.  Maira is very hardworking and dedicated to her business.  She wants to earn higher income to provide more comfort for her parents in the house they live in.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome nacida en Chuquisaca de 52 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en Villa San Carlos a 25 km de Limoncito donde tienen su parcela en la cual viven y trabajan, se dedican a la siembra de  maíz, yuca, y sandia, es el primer crédito que esta sacando con la institución  por lo cual se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la institución le brindo ya que con el crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra y despues sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de zona directamente del productor al consumidor y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Salome, 52, was born in Chuquisaca.  She has three adult children.  She and her husband are farmers in Villa San Carlos 25 kilometers from Limoncito where they have their parcel where they live and work.  They grow corn, cassava and watermelon.  

This is the first loan she’s taken out with the institution and she’s grateful for the support the institution is giving her because she’ll use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and also for everything implied in getting the soil ready for planting.  She will then sell her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer thus improving her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant and to clear the fields.

loans.name: Maria Dula

texts.es:
La Señora María de 34 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos, ella vive en la Maica central, una zona de la ciudad de Cochabamba, se dedica a la producción de leche y al mismo tiempo a la cría de cerdos, la señora María es muy dedicada a su trabajo.
La Señora María se dedica a la educación de sus hijos puesto que cuando se divorcio quedo que el esposo le pasaría pensiones para la educación de los niños pero hasta el momento no la apoya, ya que uno de los hijos se fue a vivir con su padre al Chapare. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano para la entrega de la leche para que no les falte nada a sus hijos que están en la escuela y darles lo mejor que ella pueda brindarles, La señora María se caso muy joven porque se embarazo y sus padres la obligaron a casarse y ella tuvo que vivir con la suegra por mucho tiempo y ayudar en la casa con la producción de leche que hacia la suegra,  María cuenta que estando embarazada de su hijo mayor tenía que realizar trabajos duros de campo como sembrar maíz y en ordeñar a las vacas dos veces al día pero ella no se arrepiente de haber colaborado con la suegra puesto que aprendió mucho con todo lo que vivió. De la misma manera cuenta que ella tuvo un accidente cuando era joven con el cual estuvo hospitalizada como dos meses ya que tenía un golpe fuerte en la cabeza, pero ella da gracias a Dios porque se ha recuperado bien y puede hacer su trabajo sin problemas.
La señora María solicita el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado, esto incrementara sus ingresos porque podrá entregar más litros de leche. Ella sueña con un mejor futuro para sus hijos y les pide que jamás cometan el error que cometió de casarse joven sin antes haber acabado sus estudios y sin tener una profesión, quiere que su hija pueda realizar una carrera y tener una vida mejor que la que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
María, 34, is divorced and has three children.  She lives in the Maica Central, a zone in the city of Cochabamba.  She’s a dairy farmer and also raises pigs.  María is very dedicated to her work.

María is dedicated to her children’s education because when she became divorced it was agreed that her husband would send money to cover the children’s school costs but to date he’s not done so because one of the children went to live with his father in Capare.

She starts working very early to deliver milk so that her children who are in school will not need anything and to be able to give them the very best possible she can.

María married very young because she got pregnant and her parents forced her to get married.  She had to live with her mother-in-law for a long time and to help with her mother-in-law’s dairy business.  María relates that while pregnant with her oldest son she had to do heavy field work like plant corn and milk the cows twice daily but she’s not sorry to have helped her mother-in-law because she learned a lot through that life experience.

She also relates that she suffered an accident when she was young that kept her hospitalized for two months because she’d had a strong bump on her head.  Thanks be to God she has recovered well and is able to do her work problem-free.

María is asking for a loan to buy a dairy cow.  This will increase her income because she’ll be able to deliver more liters of milk.  

She dreams with a better future for her children and she begs them not to make the same mistake she did of marrying young before finishing her schooling and having a profession.  She wants her daughter to have a career and a better life than the one she’s had.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Domar

texts.es: El Joven Domar nacido en la ciudad de Cochabamba tiene 18 años de edad,  el tiene su pequeña parcelita de 5 hectáreas, ubicada en Villa San Carlos a 25km de Limoncito, en la cual se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra maíz, y sandia, es el primer crédito que esta sacando con la institución  por lo cual se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que la institución le brindo ya que con el crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra y sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domar was born in the city of Cochabamba; he’s 18 years old.  He has a small, 5 hectare parcel located in Villa San Carlos 25 kilometers from Limoncito where he grows corn and watermelon.

This is the first loan he’s taking out with the institution and he’s grateful for the support he’s getting from the institution because he’ll use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and will also use it for everything involved in preparing the soil for planting.  He sells his crops in the local market thus improving his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn seeds to plant and to clear the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. Mercedes sigue con la tienda D. lavandería y tintorería y le está yendo muy bien. 

Mercedes con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar por ejemplo detergentes, tintes, perfumes y otras cosas más.
 
Mercedes se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mercedes continues to participate in the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank which is a part of the Arariwa Association's microfinance unit in the city of Cusco. Mercedes still has her laundry and dry-cleaning business and it is going very well. 

She did very well with the previous loan and she was able to obtain many benefits. For this reason, she wants to request another loan because it will help her a lot.

Mercedes needs the loan in order to purchase detergents, dyes, perfumes and other items. 

She is grateful for this opportunity that has been provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase detergent, dyes, perfumes and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more black carob honey and to make his toffees for sale.

loans.name: Paulina Gliceria

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos, dos independientes, con estudios D. educación primaria incompleto.
	
Trabaja desD. hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artesanía en bordados, teje llicllas, chalinas,  también venD. quinua lavada y habas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo  D. S/. 700.00 nuevo dinero que invertirá en la compra D. un rollo D.  bayetas, lanas, un quintal D. quinua y habas molidas, estos productos los venD. en la ciudad D. Tacna.

La señora desea traer casacas D. la Paz para vender en Tacna y así generar otros ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II”  Communal Bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, in the Puno department. She is 53, separated, and has three children, two of whom are independent. She did not finish elementary school.

Paulina has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business selling crafts and embroidery. She weaves llicllas [an intricately woven, colourful cloth that covers the back and shoulders; can be used as a shawl or as a sling for carrying children or items] and scarves, and also sells quinoa and beans.

She is requesting a new loan of 700 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of a roll of cloth, wool, a quintal of quinoa, and beans. She sells these products in the city of Tacna.

Paulina wants to buy jackets in La Paz to sell in Tacna and make more income.

What she most likes about her Communal Bank are the talks about business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of: a roll of cloth, wool, a quintal of quinoa, and beans

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene sigue participando en unos de los bancos comunales de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Rene sigue trabajando en el sector publico y también dedicándose a la carpintería y le está yendo muy bien. 

Rene con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Rene requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo pintura, cola de carpintero, madera y clavos.
 
Rene se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rene continues to participate in one of the communal banks of the Arariwa Association's microfinance unit in the city of Cusco. He continues to work in the public sector. He also does carpentry and this work is going very well for him.

Rene did very well with the prior loan and he was able to obtain lots of benefits. This is his motive for wanting to request another loan because it will help him a lot.

Rene needs this loan to purchase work materials like paint, carpenter’s glue, wood and nails. 

Rene is grateful for this opportunity and commits to make his payments on time according to the schedule.

loans.use: purchase materials for work like paint, carpenter's glue, wood and nails.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Estudió solo la primaria.
	
La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía en bordados, como paisajes, diversos gráficos.  Nos cuenta que su mercadería la vende en Uros chulluni.  Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio.

Su nuevo prestamos  será de S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, con el cual comprará bayetas, lanas y bordados hechos. La señora trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora desea tener una casa y un carro para realizar servicios.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la cuenta interna y su ganancia generada por el ahorro.
En la foto la vemos junto a su bebé.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Chucuito Province of Puno Department.  She is 37 years old, married, and has four children.  She only has a primary education.

She sells embroidered craftwork for a living, such as landscapes and other graphics.  She tell us that she sells her merchandise in Uros Chulluni.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business.

Her new loan will be for 600 nuevos soles and she will use it to buy baize, wool, and pre-made embroidery. She works on her business alone and her husband works as a builder.

She would like to have a house and a car, to be of help.

What she likes most about her communal bank is having her own account and the money she makes by saving.

This is her in the photo with her baby.

loans.use: she will buy baize, wool, and pre-made embroidery

loans.name: Rick And Alaycia

texts.en:
Rick and Alaycia are the owners of The Pampered Pet Boutique – a mom-and-pop pet groomers with a robust pet accessories department. They got the idea for the business after adopting their dog Chopper in 2006 and quickly realizing that there was nowhere in town to buy the pet accessories they wanted. Rick, who had spent 18 years as a store manager for a large company, knew he had the experience necessary to open their own store to fill that gap. “Having my own business is something I’ve always wanted, and I had been thinking about it for years,” said Rick.  

In 2010, Opportunity Fund approved Rick and Alaycia for a loan of $5,000. With the help of Kiva lenders backfilling this loan, Rick repaired and upgraded old equipment and built up their business credit.  Over the past year, business expanded so much that they opened a second location in Brentwood, California! They are now employing six people and hope to add even more jobs in the near future.  

With the excitement of the grand opening of their second location comes the need for more money to put up new signs in front of the store. Having enjoyed their experience with Opportunity Fund the first time, they approached their local MFI for a second microloan. With this $10,000, they will improve their current marketing efforts and expand their clientele as they open a second location.

loans.use: to purchase new signage and improve marketing

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” de la comunidad de Titacani, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.  Tiene grado de instrucción educación primaria.
	
Maruja trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de comidas, artesanía en bordados y trenzados de mantas.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y dará mantenimiento a su local, también comprará arroz, azúcar, otros insumos para la preparación de los alimentos para su restaurante.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.

La señora desea tener su casa y que su hijo sea profesional.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in Titacani in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the Puno Department.  She is 28 years old and she is a single mother with one child.  She has a primary education.

Maruja has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business selling food, embroidery, and woven blankets.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will buy tables and chairs, and she will perform maintenance on her restaurant.  She will also buy rice, sugar, and other ingredients for the dishes she offers at her restaurant.  Her son helps her with her business.

She would like her own home and for her son to have a profession.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality, responsibility, and saving.

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs, and to perform maintenance on her restaurant

loans.name: Luly Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Luly es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación superior (incompleta).
	
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos su primer préstamo fue por la suma de de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías en bordados de paisajes, gráficos, etc.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital que tiene y comprará materiales como cincuenta metros de  bayetas, diez kilos de lanas de diferentes colores para sus bordados.  Su esposo trabaja en sector de educación.

La señora desea tener una tienda de artesanía para vender mejor y exportar sus productos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la cuenta interna, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Luly is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 34 years old and she lives with her partner and three children.  She has some higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business selling craftwork embroidered with landscapes and other graphics.

With this new loan of 400 nuevos soles, she will increase her capital and buy materials such as 50 meters of baize and 10 kilos of wool in different colors for her embroidery.

She would like to have a craftwork store so she could sell more and export her products.

What she likes most about her communal bank is having her own account, saving, and earning.

loans.use: to buy materials such as 50 meters of baize and 10 kilos of wool in different colors

loans.name: Lucrecia Angela

texts.es:
Lucrecia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación secundaria (incompleta).
	
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de ovejas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de cinco ovejas pequeñas para su engorde y luego venderlas a buen precio.  Su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora desea seguir con el negocio y tener ganados mejorados para incrementar su ganancia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la alegría de las socias y las charlas con las socias.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  She has some secondary education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy sheep.
	
She is asking for a new loan for 500 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy five small sheep to fatten and sell later at a good price.  Her husband works as a builder.

She would like to continue with her business and have better livestock to increase her earnings.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the happiness of the members and the chats she has with them.

loans.use: to buy five small sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cylinders of gas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Teonila

texts.es:
Doña Teonila, tiene 52 años de edad, casada desde hace 28 años, vive en Peña Blanca, Cortes  y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 22 y 25 años de edad. 
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de novedades, ropa, calzado y utensilios para cocina y otros.  Su esposo también es comerciante y le ayuda a vender en forma ambulante.
Con fin de ayudar a sus hijos a que terminaran de estudiar y crecer personalmente fue el motivo de establecer este negocio y le ha funcionado muy bien.
El financiamiento es utilizado para compra de productos de novedades, ropa, calzado, utensilios de cocina para surtir su inventario.
Desde que inició su negocio ha recibido  financiamientos con ODEF teniendo un buen record crediticio. Han sido escalonados, comenzó desde L.3,000.00, ahora a obtenido de L.15,000.00, su inventario a crecido.
Su meta es establecer el negocio en un lugar adecuado  en su casa y contar siempre con la ayuda de ODEF.
texts.en:
Teonila, age 52, has been married for 28 years.  She lives in Peña Blanca, Cortes.  She has three children; ages 20, 22, and 25.

For ten years she has been selling novelties, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils, and other items.  Her husband is also a merchant, and he helps her sell in an itinerant manner.

In order to help her children finish their education and to grow personally she established this business.  It has worked very well for her.

The loan is used to buy novelty products, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils to stock her inventory.  Since she started her business she has received loans with ODEF, and she has a good credit record.

They have been escalating.  She started at 3,000 lempiras, and now she has received 15,000 lempiras.  Her inventory has increased.

Her goal is to establish her business in a suitable place in her house and to always have help from ODEF.

loans.use: to buy novelty products, clothes, shoes, and cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Irene Edilberta

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos.  Tiene  estudios de educación secundaria.
	
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de tres años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  la venta de chifleria y bordados.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco bolsas de detergentes de diferentes tamaños, la señora dice que cada bolsa cuesta a S/. 120.00 nuevo soles, su esposos tiene un trabajo independiente.

La señora desea continuar con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el intercambio de palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Aymaras Juli II Communal Bank in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 38 years old and lives with her partner and two children.  She has a secondary education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for over three years now.  Her first loan was for 200 nuevos soles, which she invested in selling medicinal herbs and embroidery.

With this new loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will buy five bags of detergent in different sizes.  She says that each bag costs 120 nuevos soles.  Her partner has his own independent work.

She would like to continue with her business and improve her earnings.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality, responsibility, and the interaction with other members.

loans.use: to buy five bags of detergent in different sizes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to supply her clothing shop.

loans.name: Daniel Vicente

texts.es:
Daniel de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de La Libertad.

Daniel brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior (máximo 3 personas), la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia en el rubro trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos a su mototaxi. Necesita mantener sus mototaxi en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and lives with his family in their own home. They receive running water and electricity services. Daniel resides in the District of Paijan, an area known for farming and livestock breeding, which is located in the Department of La Libertad.

He provides passenger transportation services with his motorcycle taxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin that can hold people (with a maximum capacity of three passengers). Daniel works all day until 6pm. Despite the competition in this line of work, he is able to earn the necessary income to meet his family’s needs.

Daniels is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can pay for maintenance and replace the parts of his motorcycle taxi. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering excellent service to his customers. With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and continue providing financially for his family.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and to replace the parts of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es:
El Señor Melvin, tiene 39 años,  vive con su esposa y con sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara.
Desde su niñez aprendió a cultivar la tierra ayudándole a su padre. Sus ingresos los obtiene comprando y vendiendo granos básicos y como jornal (cortador de caña) en una fabrica de producción de azúcar. Con los ingresos obtenidos logro comprar un terreno que es donde actualmente esta produciendo.
Don Melvin les compra maíz y frijoles a otros productores de la comunidad y los vende obteniendo una pequeña ganancia. También él produce granos básicos  los cuales destina una parte para el consumo familiar, y la otra parte para la venta.
La comercialización la realiza alquilando los servicios de transporte para el traslado del producto hacia el mercado local. Él ha solicitado su primer crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz y frijol para la venta y la compra de insumos para la producción.
Sus planes a corto plazo es mejorar la vivienda y en un futuro  comprar mas tierra para producir y con sus ganancias adquirir un vehículo para la comercialización.
texts.en:
Melvin, age 39, lives with his wife and their two children in a rural community in the San Marcos municipality, Santa Barbara.

When he was a child he learned to cultivate the land helping his father.  He gets his income from buying and selling basic grains and cutting sugar cane in a sugar producing factory.  With the earnings that he got he managed to buy a piece of land, which is now productive. 

Melvin buys corn and beans from other producers in the community, and he sells them and gets a small income.  He also produces basic grains.  Part of the grains he produces is for family consumption, and the other part is for sale.  He markets his products by renting transportation services to transport his products to the local market.

He has requested his first loan in order to buy corn and beans to sell and to buy supplies for the production.

His short term plans are to improve his house.  In the future his plans are to buy more land for production and to use his earnings to get a vehicle for the marketing.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Discapacitados En Accion Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Alberta tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y tiene una hija que es independiente. Tiene 4 años con Edaprospo - Prosperidad y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como gaseosas, cerveza, detergentes, galletas y otros; tiene 20 años en este trabajo y comenzó vendiendo sin proponérselo porque cuando ella llegaba con gaseosa a su casa, sus vecinos empezaron a pedirle que les venda, al principio ella lo tomó como broma, pero luego se dio cuenta que sería una buena idea D. negocio y como ella deseaba construir su casa no vio mejor opción que vender gaseosas. También se dedica al lavado D. autos y cuenta con un año D. trabajo en este negocio, hasta el momento ya ha logrado construir su casa y los gastos que cubren sus ingresos están destinados a las necesidades del hogar y ahorros para alguna emergencia.

Su plan para el futuro es tener una cafetería o jugueria y lograr que su hija sea profesional; si tuviera capital lo invertiría en la compra D. insumos para jugueria o cafetería. Piensa usar el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. cerveza, se encarga D. pagar las necesidades D. su casa y su esposo el pago D. luz y agua; tiene 2 años con el grupo el cual esta conformado por 8 personas, y que se formó tras un acuerdo entre vecinos; el nombre lo pusieron debido a que la mayoría del grupo forma parte D. una asociación D. discapacitados. Ella lleva 3 años como presidenta.
texts.en:
Sra. Alberta is 54 years old, married, and has a daughter who is independent. She has been with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for four years. Alberta sells groceries such as sodas, beer, detergents, cookies, and other products. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and had no intention of getting into this business. When her neighbors saw her come home with sodas, they started asking her to sell to them. At first she thought it was a joke, but Alberta later figured out that it would be a good idea for a business. She had wanted to build a house, so she saw no better option than selling sodas. Alberta also manages a car wash, which has been in operation for one year. At the moment she wants to build her house, cover the necessary household expenses, and have some money saved up for emergencies.

Her plans for the future are to open either a cafeteria or juice bar. She also wants to see her daughter become a professional. If she has the capital, Alberta will invest in the purchase of supplies for a juice bar or cafeteria. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of beer. Alberta and her husband need to pay for household necessities, such as electricity and water.

For the past two years, she has been part of this group of eight people that was formed in an agreement among neighbors. The name of this group came about because most of the members are part of an association for disabled people, where Alberta has served as president for three years.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: El Lucero De Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yanet tiene 29 años, convive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Lucero de las Flores”, eligieron el nombre porque las socias viven en la zona de las Flores y su entusiasmo por formar un grupo lo asocian a una luz de esperanza. 

La Sra. Yanet tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, cervezas y demás; con este negocio ya lleva 4 años. Ella vio el emprendimiento de su hermano y de su cuñado cuando abrieron sus propias bodegas años atrás, y al ver que era un negocio rentable decidió meterse en el mismo campo, descubriendo que era buena en este rubro. Ella empezó a trabajar motivada por el deseo de comprar su terreno a fin de tener su casa propia; al cabo de 3 años lo consiguió, no sin antes haberse esforzado mucho. Este ha sido su mayor logro hasta el momento, lo que sigue después es construirlo de material noble y darle comodidad y bienestar a su familia.

Debido al costo que ha requerido al comprar su terreno, aun no puede ahorrar, pero con el apoyo del grupo esto va a ser posible. Entre sus planes futuros esta el de abrir una pollería en su terreno. Por el momento ella se ocupa de los gastos de la casa y su esposo cubre los gastos del terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanet is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two young children. She is the president of the Communal Bank “El Lucero de Las Flores”. This name was chosen by the members because they live in the District of Las Flores and their enthusiasm to form a group represents the light of hope.

Sra. Yanet has a store in her home where she sells groceries, sodas, beer, and other products. She has been in this business for four years. Yanet watched her brother and her brother-in-law open their own stores years ago and saw them develop profitable businesses, so she decided to go into the same line of work for herself. She started working because she wanted to buy land for building her own house. Yanet achieved her goal in three years and she would not have accomplished this if she had not worked so hard. This by far has been her greatest achievement to date. Now she wants to proceed with the construction by using solid materials in order to provide greater comfort for her family’s well-being.

Due to the expenses related to purchasing her land, she has not been able to save. With the support of her group, Yanet now sees that this is possible. Her future plans include opening a poultry business on her property. At the moment, she is concerned about the household expenses while her husband takes care of the costs of their property.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en: Eang is 47 years old, married, has four children and leads a three-member loan group. For the last 20 years, she has made a living as a farmer who grows vegetables. Eang and the members of her group have been with VisionFund since 2006. She is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase crop yields and earn enough income for her family to have sufficient food to eat and also set aside money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is a 45 year-old farmer with 6 children. She is the leader of a group with 5 members. She has been a farmer for 25 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers to better cultivate rice on her farmland. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to then sell her crops for a good price, which would enable her to earn more income for her family's expenses and for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 42 years old and has 5 children. Her children are still in school.

She is a farmer, and she feeds cattle to help prepare her land and for plowing purposes. She has been farming on her farmland for 12 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy a water pump and fertilizers for her farmland. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase and improve the quality of her crop yield in order to sell her crops for a good price, which would enable her to earn more income to feed her family, to save for the future, and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sok Heang

texts.en:
Sok Heang is 40 years old. She has five children, all of whom are still in school.

She is a farmer, and she plants vegetables (such as cucumbers and lotus) to sell for additional income. She has been planting vegetables and farming for seven years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Sok Heang requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her plants and farmland. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to improve the quality of her crop yield so that she can generate more income to buy necessary household goods for her family, to expand her business, to keep her children in school, and to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin is a 41-year-old farmer who has five children, all of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming and providing transportation services using a horse cart that she owns. She has been a farmer for almost 20 years and received her first loan from VisionFund in 2010. She paid it back completely and on-time, and is applying for a new loan to cultivate a rice paddy. She hopes that this will allow her to increase her crop yields and earn more money to use to feed her family, keep her children in school and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to cultivate a rice paddy on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokunthy

texts.en: Sokunthy is 47 years old, married and has two children. She earns a living as a teacher and supplements her income by farming and raising fish. She has been a teacher for almost 20 years and is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use the loan to buy a motorbike to use to commute to and from school. This will reduce her travel time and allow her to devote more time to farming and raising fish.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to use for commuting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, a 47-year-old married mother of two, is the leader of a group with five members. A farmer who has been growing rice and other crops for 27 years, she also sells khmer noodles and fried bananas for additional income.

Now requesting her first loan with VisionFund, Na wants to buy fertilizers and plant more rice. She hopes the loan will help to increase her crop yields and therefore earn her more income to expand her business, increase her savings and help to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plant rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with two children. One child attends school while the other one is too young for school. Hamisi has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hamisi has operated a function decoration business for the past 5 years. His potential clients are mostly people around his town who need his services. He faces a major challenge with seasonality because he works during the festive seasons.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan Hamisi wants to purchase lights, cables and wires for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase lights, cables and wires for his business.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. Clemence owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children.

Clemence has operated a retail shop for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge with break-ins by thieves. She dreams of expanding her shop into wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Clemence to wants purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and matchboxes for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and matchboxes for her shop.

loans.name: Asmin

texts.en:
Asmin is a married woman with 5 children, 3 of whom are enrolled in school and 2 of whom are adults. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. Asmin owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her family.

Asmin has operated a clothes selling business for the past 8 years. Her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a married woman with four school aged children.  Her husband is a contractor, and financially they both help meet the family's basic needs. 

She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Florah has operated a grocery store for the past five years.  She is also a farmer.  Clients are local residents.  Florah says her major challenge is theft of goods.  She hopes to expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more vegetables for her grocery store.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her grocery.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with one school aged child.  Her husband is a businessman.  They lives in a rental house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for their child.

Zuhura has operated a beauty saloon for the past 4 years; her clients are local community members.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Zuhura wants to purchase a dryer, hair food and shampoos for her saloon.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, hair food and shampoos for her saloon.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children who are enrolled in school.  His wife is a businesswoman.  They live in a rental house with electricity and piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Hassan has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 10 years.  His clients are local villagers.  His major challenge is a tree ban that doesn’t allow charcoal sales.  He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal and complete piping for his new water business.  He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its low loan interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and do some piping for his new piped water business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cereal for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married mother with six children.  One is enrolled in school and the others are grown up.  She and her husband are also farmers.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Dama has operated a cereal selling business for the past 15 years.  Her clients are local residents.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality; during the dry seasons there is no harvest.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more cereal for resale.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two school going children.  Her husband is a businessman.  They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Grace has operated a retail shop for the past two years; her clients are local villagers.  She faces a major challenge of selling on credit to her customers because they take too long to repay.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase rice, maize flour, soap and cooking oil for her shop.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour, soap and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with 5 school going children.  Her husband is a contractor who contributes financially towards the family's success.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for their children.

Luvuno has operated a tailoring business for the past three years.  Her clients are local villagers. She faces a major challenge of untrustworthy customers who do not pay their bills on time.  Luvuno is also a farmer.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase a plot of land to build a tailoring shop because she is currently renting one.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a tailoring shop because she is currently renting one.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven school going children.  Her husband is a teacher who helps cover the cost of basic family needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for their family and school fees for their children.

Mupa has operated a grocery for the past eight years.  She also runs a motorbike transportation business.  Her clients are local villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality; in the rainy season there are low sales due to good harvests so people do not purchase groceries.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase vegetables and other groceries for her business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and other groceries for her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with 5 school going children.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nyamvula has operated a cereal selling business for the past 15 years; in addition she also runs a grocery.  Her potential clients are the local villagers. She faces a major challenge of drought; there is no harvest during this time.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more cereal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access fund to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a divorced woman with four children.  Two are enrolled in school.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Julia has operated a vegetable stall for the past 3 years; her clients are local residents.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Julia dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase vegetables for his business.  Julia decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 5 years; her potential clients are local residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation her goods. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan Luvuno wants to purchases more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire loans.

loans.use: to purchases more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with 7 school going children. Her husband is a technician who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Amina has operated a firewood selling business for the past 2 years; her clients are her neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Amina wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a married woman with 5 school going children.  She owns a house with piped water but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Uchi has operated as a farmer for the past 5 years; her potential clients are local residents. She faces a major challenge of pests attacking her crops. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan Uchi wants to purchase seeds for planting on her farm.  She decided join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a single mother with one school going child.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanalima has operated a retail shop for the past 7 years; her clients are local villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Mwanalima wants to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a married man with three children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hillary has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 6 years; his potential clients are local residents.  He faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in the market.  He dreams of opening a retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan Hillary wants to purchase 80 sacks of charcoal for resale.  He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase 80 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 4 children who are enrolled in school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She lives in a rental home with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated as a food vendor for the past 7 years; her clients are her neighbors.  She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market.  She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Fatuma wants to purchase wheat flour and beans for her business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.name: Shamsan

texts.en:
Shamsan is a 30-year-old man living in Sana'a. He is married and a father of two young children. He attended high school but could not study at the university because he didn't have anyone to support his studies.

Having worked in his friend's salon as a barber for a couple of years in order to feed his family, it was his dream to establish his own independent business (a Barber Shop) but due to financial challenges, he could not make his dream a reality. With income he collected from his past work in his friend's salon,  Shamsan started his independent business a year ago and called two of his friends to work with him. Currently he is in need of support to purchase beauty supplies that he needs in his salon.
 
Shamsan looked for financial support here and there but in vain. Finally, he was guided by one of his friends to apply for a loan from AMB. Shamsan visited one of AMB's branches recently opened in the street near his shop and took a loan of 80,000 Rials in order to purchase all the supplies needed for his salon.

In the future, Shamsan hopes to expand his business and attract new clients. He also hopes to open another salon on another street and make it possible for other free young people to work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Maritza Elizabet

texts.es:
Maritza D. 54 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuentan con servicio D. luz solamente, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

DesD. hace 3 años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en su mismo domicilio en donD. ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Cuenta con una clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Maritza observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente desD. un principio. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería como productos D. consumo diario y abarrotes en general.  Va a comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades lo que ayuda en bajar el precio que paga. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles. Maritza es muy trabajador y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para tener un negocio más amplio y bien surtido.
texts.en:
Maritza is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Maritza resides in the District of TambogranD., which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture and livestock breedking.

For the past three years, Martiza has managed her own business from home where she offers her customers all types of products, including basic necessities and groceries. Since she has a customer base, Maritza uses the income she earns to take care of her family obligations.

Seeing that her business has grown significantly from the start, Maritza wants to continue expanding her business by purchasing more merchandise, such as everyday consumer products and groceries. She will buy these products in large quantities, which will help lower the unit price that she pays. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maritza is hardworking and responsible. She wants to earn as much income as possible so that she can have a larger and well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy everyday consumer products and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.es:
María de 49 años de edad, es soltera, reside en su casa propia junto a unos  familiares, ubicada  en la zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola y ganadera.

Ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar mango y arroz, ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos diarios personales. También cría y comercializa ganado ovino.

María desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar nuevas plantaciones. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, single, and lives in her own home with some relatives. She resides in the rural section of the District of Las Lomas, which is part of the Department of Piura. This is an area known for farming and livestock breeding.

María has a piece of farmland on which she grows mangos and rice. She has several years of experience in this line of work. Throughout this entire time, she has gained plenty of knowledge of how to manage these crops. The income she generates from this business will be used to cover her daily personal expenses. She also raises and sells sheep.

María wants to buy fertilizers so that she can maintain her land for planting new crops. This will enable her to have a good harvest. In order to accomplish this goal, she needs to request a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining her farmland.

loans.name: Santos Justiniano

texts.es:
Santos de 51 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa, aún no tienen hijos, su casa cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en lazona urbana del distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Santos brinda servicio de mantenimiento de vehículos (mecánico), su taller se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, también realiza trabajos de pintado y planchado de vehículos, por los buenos trabajos que realiza y el buen trato que tiene es conocido en la zona por sus clientes, con los ingresos  que tenga podrá solventar sus gastos de su casa.

Para poder ampliar su negocio ha creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar algunos materiales que necesita y realizar algunos arreglos en su taller para seguir brindado el servicio a sus clientes, al incrementarse sus ganancias podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y él.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. They do not have children. Their house has all of the basic services. Santos resides in the urban section of the District of Chepen, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This area is known for its businesses in the agriculture and livestock trades.

Santos provides vehicle maintenance services as a mechanic. His workshop is located in an area outside of his house. He also performs paint and auto body work. As result of the good work he performs and the excellent service he is known for providing to his local customers, Santos is able to generate an income to cover his household expenses.

In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy a few needed materials and make some repairs around his workshop in order to continue providing service to his customers. This will allow him to increase his earnings so that he can repay this loan and improve the quality of life for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy needed materials and to make a few repairs to his workshop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 47 años de edad, es casado, reside en su casa propia junto a su  familia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. También cría y vende aves de corral. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

Manuel desea comprar fertilizantes y para  brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his family. The only service they receive is electricity. Manuel resides in the rural section of Tambogrande which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Manuel has a piece of land on which he grows lemons. He has several years of experience in this line of work. Throughout this entire time, he has gained much knowledge of how to maintain these crops. He also raises and sells poultry. The income he generates is used to cover the daily financial needs of his family.

Manuel wants to buy fertilizers and maintain his land so that he can plant a new crop of lemons and obtain a good harvest. In order to accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining his land.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 45 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Nancy desde hace un años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de su ganado, con las ganancias que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Nancy es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo trazado.
texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old.  She lives with her family in their own home, which does not have basic services.  Their home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande District, Piura Department.  The people of this area work in agriculture, raising livestock and handicrafts.

For the last few years, Nancy has made her living raising and selling sheep.  Her corral is located behind her house.  The sheep are suitable and she feeds them animal feed as well as natural grasses so they can achieve an ideal weight to be offered for sale in the different markets of the area.  This way, she can earn a good profit and meet her daily, household expenses.

Nancy has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (USD $575) from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase animal feed and to ensure the health of her livestock.  With the profits she will earn from both of her businesses (see previous loan description), she will be able to cover the loan payments and have a better quality of life.  Nancy is a person who with effort and a lot of determination has learned how to help her family to get ahead so they can meet the goals they have laid out for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and  to ensure the health of her livestock.

loans.name: Elsa Victoria

texts.es:
Elsa de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en su casa, cuenta con el servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 2 años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  a su familia.

Elsa observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Elsa es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27 years old and lives in her home with her husband and child. The only service they receive is electricity. Elsa resides in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. This is area is known for its farming and livestock businesses.

For the past two years, she has managed a store inside of her home. There she offers her neighbors and local customers different everyday consumer products, basic necessities, and groceries. She has an established customer base and does not have any other competition near her business. With this business, she is able to cover her financial expenses and help her family.

Elsa has noticed that her business has grown considerably, so she wants to continue expanding by purchasing more merchandise such as food products and groceries. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Elsa is hardworking and dedicated to her business. She wants to achieve better earnings so that she can provide greater comforts for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y 3 hijos de 14 años, 12 años y un bebe de 4 meses.

El señor José, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de motorista  y al comercio de ropa de vestir, lociones y cosméticos en junto con su compañera de vida, quines tienen  más de 6 años de dedicarse ha esta actividad, la cual la aprendió de un familiar que se dedicaba al comercio de ropa. 

Actualmente cuentan con  4 docenas de prendas de vestir como: blusa para damas, camisas para caballero y ropa de bebe. El señor José siempre se ha dedicado a prestar sus servios como motorista, hoy en día en apoyo de su compañera de vida a la venta de ropa.

La mercadería la compra en un departamento de la zona oriental del país, que se encuentra ha 26 kilómetros de la ciudad de donde el vive, en esta cuidad se pueden comprar la ropa ha precio cómodos para su comercialización y también donde él vive en el día del comercio que son los domingos, cuando llegan comerciantes de otras zonas ha vender ropa. 

José invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropa, para su comercialización: como lo son, 5 docenas de blusas para damas, 5 docenas de faldas,  5 docenas de camisas para caballeros, 5 docenas de pantalones y  para bebe: pañales, mantillas cuturinas calcetines, gorros, entre otros más.

Al comprar toda esta ropa contara con mercadería de moda y abastecerá la demanda que tiene en este momento, ya que llegan clientes a su vivienda donde comercializa y les dice que no tiene hasta la próxima semana. Realizando la inversión él podrá satisfacer la demanda existente y de esta manera venderá más y por ende sus niveles de ingresos o ganancias incrementaran. Con estos ingresos tiene planeado adquirir vitrinas donde pueda mostrar sus prendas de vestir, adquiriendo mobiliario para establecer un mini bazar, mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 33, lives with his partner and three children aged 14, 12, and 4 months. He works providing his services as a driver and selling clothing, lotions, and cosmetics together with his partner. They have more than six years of experience in this line of work and learned it from a family member who worked in the clothing industry.They currently have 4 dozen garments including women's blouses, men's shirts, and baby clothing. José has always worked as a driver but today he supports his partner in selling clothing.

José will use the loan to buy clothing for his business including: 5 dozen women's blouses, 5 dozen skirts, 5 dozen men's shirts, 5 dozen pairs of pants, and diapers, socks, caps, etc. for babies. He purchases the merchandise from an area in the eastern zone of the country, 26 miles outside of the city where he lives. In this city one can buy clothing at an affordable price. Also where he lives Sundays are the days for other storekeepers to come from other places to sell clothing.

By buying this clothing, he will be able to have fashionable merchandise and meet the demand that he has at this time, as he currently has clients coming to his home and he has to tell them they have to wait until next week. With this loan he will be able to meet existing demand and thus sell more and increase his income and earning levels. With this income he is planning to purchase windows that can display his clothing, buying furniture to establish a mini bazaar, and improving the roof to his home.

loans.use: to buy women's blouses, skirts, men's shirts, pants, diapers, and socks and caps for babies

loans.name: Mariyi

texts.es:
Mariyi de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Mariyi desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y ovinos, su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones diarias de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mariyi es una madre trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Mariyi is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and child. They do not receive basic services. Mariyi resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For several years, Mariyi has been raising and selling poultry and sheep. Her animal pen is located in an area behind her house and has an ample amount of appropriate space. The animals receive a diet of balanced feed, grains, and natural grasses so that they can attain optimal growth and be offered for sale at different markets in the area. As a result, she will obtain good earnings to resolve her daily household obligations.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can buy more balanced feed for her animals. The income that she earns will be used to repay this loan and improve her family’s quality of life. Mariyi is a hardworking and committed mother who only wants to see her family succeed and have improved finances.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela de 24 años de edad, soltera, vive en una aldea de Tela Atlántida. Vive  con su madre.
Es una persona muy emprendedora. Comenzó su negocio  con los compañeros de estudio de la universidad, vendiéndoles productos de fantasía fina como, aretes, cadenas, relojes,  y como le fue muy bien, se motivó y empezó a comprar perfumes, lociones, joyería fina, ropa, productos de belleza y otro tipo de mercadería que le  encargan y así ha generado sus ingresos para cubrir gastos de su casa y ha cubierto todos sus gastos de la universidad, ya está por graduarse. 
Compra alguna mercadería que traen del extranjero y la vende a mejor precio, todo por encargo.
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y llegar a  tener una tienda ya establecida de mercadería en un lugar estratégico para la venta.
texts.en:
Graciela is 24 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in a village in Tela Atlántida.  She is a very enterprising person.

She started her business selling costume jewelry like earrings, chains, and watches to her school colleagues at the university.  As that went very well for her she started to buy perfume, lotion, fine jewelry, clothes, beauty products, and other types of merchandise that she has orders for.  This has generated income to cover her household expenses.  It has also covered all of her university expenses; she is about to graduate.

She buys some merchandise that is from abroad, and she sells it for a better price.  This is all done by order.

Her goal is to finish her education and to have a store that is well-established with merchandise in a place that is strategic for sales.

loans.use: to buy products to sell like clothes, shoes, jewelry, and beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Isaul

texts.es:
Isaul de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Isaul se dedica desde 2 años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos) y ovinos, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.  También cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembre limón,una vez que cosecha lo comercializa y tiene otro ingreso económico para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, una vez que se engorden sus aves los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más dinero para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Isaul es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante, en especial que sus hijos logren sus metas.
texts.en:
Isaul is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Isaul resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past two years, Isaul has been raising and selling poultry (chickens and turkeys) and sheep. His animal pen is located in an area behind his house. The animals are fed a diet of balanced feed, grasses, and natural grains. Once the animals have reached optimal growth, they are offered for sale to his customers. The income he generates is used for his household expenses. In addition, Isaul has his own farmland on which he grows lemons. When his crops are harvested, they are sold as an additional source of household income.

Isaul is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for his animals and fertilizers to improve his farmland. As soon as his poultry are fattened, they will be sold at different markets in the area. By obtaining a good price for these birds, he will have more money to improve his quality of life. Isaul is a hardworking and responsible person whose only wish is for his family to move forward, especially seeing his children achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, salt, beans, lard, and other food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more feed for the goats she raises.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
María D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en su casa propia junto a su  familia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada  en la zona rural D. Olmos que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.
