Ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donD. suele sembrar mango y limón, el ya tiene varios años D. experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo D. cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria D. su familia.

María desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno D. cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación D. frutales. D. esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives in her own house with her family; it does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Olmos which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It is an area noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

She has a piece of farm land where she tends to grow mangoes and lemons; she has many years’ experience in this line of work and has leaned much about crop management.  Income from these activities is used to cover her daily family expenses.

María wants to buy fertilizer to proviD. maintenance to her farmland in order to start a new planting of fruits so that she can obtain a good harvest.  To reach this objective, she has needed to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora de 42 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona es de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Aurora desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de tubérculos (papas de diferentes variedades), su negocio lo tiene en el mercado de la zona donde vive, su negocio lo atiende diariamente, cuenta con su clientela fija y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, también para realizar algunos arreglos en su casa,con las ganancias cubrirá su crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora, 42, lives with her family in a house of her own that has running water and electricity and is located in an urban part of Bambamarca District belonging to Cajamarca Department.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

Aurora has been selling tubers (potatoes in many varieties) for many years, a business she has in her local market.  She tends to her business daily and has a regular clientele.  Income obtained allows her to cover family expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy larger amounts of stock merchandise for her business to meet customer demand and also to do some home improvements.  She will use profits from sales to repay the loan and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр женат. Он имеет свой бизнес. Жена поддерживает и помогает ему в работе. Александр продает мужскую обувь  и одежду в магазине Вернисаж. Он всегда уверен в качестве своего товара, так как раньше занимался шитьем обуви.  Александр целеустремленный и надежный. В ближайшее время он ставит для себя целью наладить связи с поставщиками нового товара. Александр просит предоставить ему кредит  в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку зимней обуви. Благодаря кредиту он сможет увеличить ассортимент и размерный ряд товара.
texts.en:
Alexander is married. He owns a business which his wife helps him run. Alexander sells men's footwear and clothing in a store called Vernisaj. He's always confident in the quality of his product; he was a shoemaker in the past. 
Alexander is driven and consistent. In the near future, he plans to establish relations with new suppliers. 
He's asking for a loan of 20,000 grivnas in order to purchase some winter footwear. With the loan, he'll be able to increase his assortment of products and their size range.

loans.use: to purchase winter footwear for resale.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена решила взять кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку  макаронных изделий и сахара, круп, новых сортов чая, которые пользуються сросом в холодное время. Предыдущий использовала для увеличения ассортимента, планирует открыть еще одну точку на рынке. Елена приобрела домой новый холодильник, а старый использует в бизнесе. Основное конкурентное приемущество бизнеса Елены - самый большой выбор чаев и кофе самых разных марок, для требовательного покупателя.
texts.en: Yelena decided to obtain a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase pasta, sugar, grains and new varieties of tea that are in demand during the cold season.  She used her previous loan to increase her product assortment because she plans to open another retail outlet at the market.  Yelena bought a new refrigerator for her home and uses an old one for her business.  Yelena's main business advantage over her competition is the largest selection of tea and coffee of various brands, to satisfy the most demanding customer.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, sugar, grains and new varieties of tea

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana, married with a grown daughter, lives in Nikopol.  She sells women’s suits and knitted wear.  

Tatyana owns two selling locations at different city markets. Her merchandise always sells well because of the lower price policy she has set in her kiosks.  She has a loyal clientele, some whom even come from other cities to buy from her.  A hard worker who usually works late hours, Tatyana has been in the trade for 10 years.  Currently, her monthly net profit is about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Tatyana, always very committed to her family, tries to provide the best for her daughter, a college student.  She is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to buy assorted merchandise for her selling locations to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una aldea rural de Puerto Cortes, tiene 5 hijos de 30, 27, 23, 16 y 8 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, y además vende carne  y algunas verduras y frutas en cantidades pequeñas. Ella trabaja muy duro todo el día. Su  clientela esta en su aldea y ha crecido. De este negocio salen los ingresos que cubren los gastos de alimentación y gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
Ha   trabajado con financiamiento con ODEF, este es su sexto préstamo y lo utiliza para compra de materia prima como el Maíz, carnes, verduras y frutas.
Actualmente, cocina en una hornilla tradicional bajo una galera al aire libre, su meta es mejorar su hornilla y local para mantener su clientela.
texts.en:
Teresa is 56 years old and a single mother.  She lives in a rural village in Puerto Cortes.  She has five children; ages 30, 27, 23, 16, and 8.  Two of them attend school.

She has been making and selling corn tortillas for ten years.  She also sells meat and some fruits and vegetables in small quantities.  She works very hard all day.  Her customers are in her village, and clientele has grown.

It is from this business that she gets the income to cover the food expenses and her children’s educational expenses.

She has worked with loans from ODEF.  This is her sixth loan.  She will use it to buy raw material like corn, meat, fruits, and vegetables.

She currently cooks with a traditional stove in a kitchen in the open air.

Her goal is to improve her stove and her place in order to keep her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn or corn flour to make tortillas and to buy meat, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia, es una señora de 61 años de edad, muy trabajadora, soltera por viudez, vive en la ciudad del  Progreso,Yoro, tiene 5  hijos de 32, 30, 28, 26 y 23 años de edad,  4 de ellos  viven en el exterior del pais, y solo una hija de  23  años es quien vive con ella y le ayuda en el negocio.
Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos  cosméticos  como cremas, perfumes, lociones, glases y productos Avon. Su producto es entregado al cliente conforme  pedidos.
Actualmente solicitó un séptimo préstamo para compra de más productos incrementando así su inventario.
Su plan es mantener el negocio mas surtido, que le genere ingresos para salir adelante en su vida.
texts.en:
Oralia is a very hard-working 61 year old woman.  She is single because she is widowed.  She lives in the city of Progreso, Yoro.  She has five children; ages 32, 30, 28, 26, and 23.  Four of them live out of the country.  Only her 23 year old daughter lives with her and helps her with the business.

For seven years she has been selling cosmetic products like creams, perfumes, lotions, glazes, and Avon products.  Her product is delivered to the customer based on their orders.

She is currently requesting her seventh loan to buy more products to increase her inventory.

Her plan is to keep the business better stocked, which will generate income in order to get ahead in her life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (creams, lotions, perfumes, and Avon products).

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married and has a two year old son.  He runs a family business growing tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes in greenhouses.  His wife and her parents help Alexei with the business. 

Alexei started this business seven years ago.  Vegetables are in high demand in this area and the business is successful.  Recently Alexei bought a second piece of land and put another greenhouse there.  He needs a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase seeds, film and water systems for his greenhouses.

Alexei's goal is to fix his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, film, and water systems.

loans.name: Gashununu 2 Sk Group

texts.fr:
Philémon fait partie du groupe Gashununu 2 SK. Le nom du groupe signifie «le nom de l’endroit ». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Philémon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et travaille avec des coopératives. Avec les profits, il prévoit  construire une maison et scolarises ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philémon (Filemoni) is a member of Gashununu 2 SK Group, whose name means "name of the place". He's 38 years old, and married with four children, age 3 to 12. Two of them attend school. His own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Philémon is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, to be used to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business. His strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilizers and work with cooperatives.

With his profits, he intends to build a house a send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Rwibumba 1 Sk Group

texts.fr:
Théophile fait partie du groupe Rwibumba 1 SK. Il a 28 ans et il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 an de secondaire.

Théophile est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des engrais. Dans les prochaines années, Théophile voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de se marie et construire une maison moderne.
texts.en:
Théophile is a member of Rwibumba 1 SK Group. He's 28 years old and unmarried. He attended middle school for six years.

He's a rice cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilizers. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be a big rice farmer in his region.

With his profits, he intends to get married and build a modern house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new products (sandals).

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, tiene 57 años, es soltera, vive con sus tres hijos y su madre en la comunidad de Mariposas en la zona rural del municipio de las Flores,  Lempira.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, específicamente la producción de café, también posee una pequeña pulpería.
Hace aproximadamente 8 años que se dedica a la producción de café el cual comercializa través de  compradores intermediarios que llegan hasta su comunidad.
Desde el año pasado le ha brindado un mejor mantenimiento  a la finca debido al alto precio que ha alcanzo el cultivo en el ámbito internacional, lo cual le ha dejado muy buenas ganancias. Esto la hace sentir mayor motivación y entusiasmo por continuar con dicha actividad.
Ella piensa invertir el préstamo en la  ampliación del área del cultivo y en la compra de fertilizantes para aumentar la producción. Con las ganancias espera continuar apoyando a sus hijos en la educación y seguir cuidando de su madre.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 57 years old and single.  She lives with her three children and her mother in the Mariposas community in the rural area of the Las Flores zone in Lempira.

Her financial activity is farming.  Specifically, she produces coffee.  She also has a small grocery store.

She has been producing coffee for approximately eight years.  She sells it through intermediary buyers who come to her community.  Since last year she has provided better maintenance to the farm because of the high price of the crop at the international level.  This has left her with very good income.  It makes her have greater motivation and enthusiasm for continuing with said business activity. 

She plans to use the loan to expand the crop area and to buy fertilizers in order to increase production.  With the income she hopes to continue supporting her children’s education and to continue taking care of her mother.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Karol Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Karol tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad rural de Piladeros en el Municipio de Nueva Frontera departamento de Santa Barbara.
Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos para su familia, es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, harina de trigo y de maíz, huevos) y productos de higiene.
Su negocio lo inicio con recursos propios y posteriormente ha tenido la oportunidad de administrar varios créditos, lo cual le ha permitido sostener su negocio y su  familia. 
Considera como principales dificultades por enfrentar, los altos precios de los productos alimenticios y las  pocas ventas en algunas temporadas del año.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo de L.17,000.00 ,  el que invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, productos para el aseo y medicinas.
Su meta es ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, aumentar su negocio y  ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karol is 30 years old and in a common-law-marriage.  She lives with her husband and two children in a rural community of Piladeros in the Nueva Frontera municipality, Santa Barbara department.

Her business activity, which generates income for the family, is a small grocery store.  She sells basic needs products (rice, beans, wheat and corn flour, and eggs) and hygiene products.  She started her business with her own resources.  Later, she had the opportunity to manage several loans,  This has allowed her to maintain her business and her family.

She considers the main difficulties she faces to be the high prices of food products and the low sales in some seasons of the year.  

She has currently requested a loan for 17,000 lempiras to buy food products, hygiene products, and medicines.  Her goals are to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, to increase her business, and to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Gutierrez

texts.es:
F. vive en la cuidad de Cochabamba, es casado tiene 3 hijos, trabaja en una marmoleria hace mas de 22 años, el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo, que apenas alcanza parar sustentar a su familia, su esposa genera para la familia otras ingresos por la venta de leche de 4 vacas que posee, esta leche la entrega y vente en el barrio.
F. tenia en mente poder construir una cocina para su casa hace años atras, pero no podia ahorrar y tampoco encontraba financiamiento para su construcción. Atraves de CIDRE y gracias a los recursos que canaliza KIVA, se le a podido otorgar ahora un prestamo para la contruccion de la cocina para su vivienda. el esta muy animado a contruirla con sus propias manos, y agradecido a la vez a KIVA por este apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
F. lives in the city of Cochabamba.  He’s married and has three children.  He’s worked at a marble quarry for over 22 years but the salary he earns is very low, it’s barely enough to support his family.  His wife earns additional family income selling milk from the four cows she owns; she sells the milk around the neighborhood.

F. has been planning to build a kitchen at home for many years now but has been unable to save up enough to do so and could not find financing for the construction.  Now, through CIDRE and thanks to resources that KIVA channels, he has been granted a loan to build the kitchen for his house.  He is very anxious to get started building it with his own hands and is grateful to KIVA for this financial support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, de 20 años, es una señorita trabajadora, dinámica y muy creativa, es una joven estudiante, soltera, sin hijos y con ganas de sobre salir adelante. Vive en casa de sus  padres junto a su hermana. Ella aporta lo necesario para pagar algunos servicios básicos del hogar. EL trabajo de Patricia consiste en la elaboración de pulseras, aretes, decoración de relojes, collares y otros adornos femeninos. Tiene una pequeño taller en su casa desde donde elabora sus bonitos productos que son muy buscados en el instituto en el que estudia. Lleva realizando este trabajo por dos años y sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de clases. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder cumplir con su carrera, pues estudia en un instituto nacional, en donde la exigen mucho y tiene que darse mucho tiempo para estudiar pero sin descuidar su fuente de ingresos. Le va bien y espera poder más adelante poner una boutique de ropa y bisutería regional. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, está feliz de pertenecer a este grupo, ya que todos son muy responsables y siempre están al día en sus pagos, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que le es de mucha ayuda para su actividad el tener buen capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para poder seguir elaborando sus productos, además necesita algunas herramientas para tener un mejor acabado en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Patricia, 20, is a hardworking, dynamic, very creative young woman.  She is a student, single and has no children and very much wants to get ahead.  She lives in her parents’ house in the company of a sister.  She contributes what’s needed to cover some of the house’s basic utility charges.

Patricia’s work consists in making bracelets, earrings, decorations for watches, necklaces and other women’s accessories.  She has a small workshop at home where she manufactures pretty items that are quite sought after at her school.  She’s been doing this work for two years and her main customers are her classmates.  What she likes about her work is that it gives her time to do her school work because she’s going to a national institute where they require quite a bit of work from her and she has to give herself time to study while not neglecting her source of income.  She does well and hopes to be able to open a boutique later on to sell clothes and regional costume jewelry.

This will be her second MFP loan.  She is happy to belong to this group because they are all very responsible and always up to date with their payments.  She hopes to be able to continue working together because it’s of great help for her activity to have good working capital.  She will use the requested amount to buy materials to continue making her products; she also needs a few tools to better finish her items.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make more costume jewelry.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es: Nadia, de 35 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Nadia, consiste en la venta de comida, ella desde muy temprano sale al mercado a comprar los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus alimentos, ya por las tardes sale a la vereda de su casa y empieza a ofrecer los deliciosos y muy bien preparados Juanes, tacachos, asados de pollo y cerdo. Tiene dos años realizando este trabajo,  y lo hace sola ya que sus hijos aún son muy pequeños y su pareja llega de trabajar tarde. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite dar un tiempo a su hogar, es decir puede cuidar a sus hijos, ya que están en una etapa que necesitan mucho cuidado. Le esta yendo bien en su trabajo pues a diario vende mucho y espera poder mantenerse y poco a poco implementar su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos y no dejar mal a sus nuevas compañeras de grupo. Desea seguir trabajando juntos para así tener un respaldo económico y también poder ampliar su inversión mas adelante. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará materiales (mesas, sillas, manteles) y algunos ingredientes para seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nadia, 35, is a cheerful, dynamic woman.  She lives with her spouse and three children who are 7, 5 and 2 years old in their own house.  Nadia’s work consists in selling food.  She goes to the market very early to buy the ingredients to prepare the food because in the afternoon she goes out into the street in front of her house to start selling her delicious and well prepared Juanes [made with rice, pieces of poultry meat, eggs, olives, aromatic herbs and spices, all wrapped up in "bijao" (plant from the jungle) leaves and boiled in clay pots], Tacachos [hash-like dish of plantain and pork or chicken] and roasted pork and chicken.  She’s been in this business for two years and works alone since her children are still too young and her spouse returns late from work.  What she likes about her work is that it leaves her with time to tend to her household, that is, she can care for her children since they are at a stage where they need much attention.  She is doing well in her work because she sells quite a bit every day and she hopes to stay in business and gradually equip it.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She expects to be very punctual with her payments and not disappoint her fellow group members.  She wants to continue working together to have economic support and also to expand her investment later on.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as some ingredients needed to continue working.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and raw materials for her food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and also tools for her workshop.

loans.name: Choijamts

texts.en: Choijamts is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (or traditional Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Both of his children are in school and he and his wife earn a living by selling second-hand clothes.They started their business in 2003 by renting a counter in a local market. They have done well because they handpick all of their products and sterilize them before they go on sale. Choijamts is eager to expand his business and is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy winter clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida, de 21 años, es una joven mujer que tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de dos años. Juntos habitan  en  casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y a sus abuelos. EL trabajo de Ida consiste en el venta de pescado, ella desde temprano por la mañana sale en busca de pescado fresco en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad, de ahí lleva sus productos hasta la casa del padre de su conviviente lugar que es muy concurrida. Es así que coloca una mesa donde expende éste alimento marino,  y espera a que los clientes lleguen en busca de pescado fresco. Tiene un año realizando este trabajo y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola,  ya que su pareja trabaja en otro departamento del Perú, por lo que le envía  alguna ayuda económica. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder estar en su casa haciendo otras actividades por la tarde, además todos los días hay buenos ingresos ya que le genera buenas ganancias de su trabajo, espera poder mantenerse y quizá más adelante poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, le fue muy el primer préstamo demostrando responsabilidad, y  espera poder seguir así, pagando justo a tiempo sus cuotas. Agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindan de poder aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que así le genera mayor ganancia. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará pescado fresco, además comprará algunas bandejas y materiales para poder vender con mayor comodidad su producto.
texts.en:
Ida, 21, is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives with her spouse and their two-year-old son.  They live together in her parents’ house with her parents and her grandparents.  

Ida’s work consists in selling fish.  She goes out early in the morning to look for fresh fish in the city’s Bellavista market.  From there she takes the products to her spouse’s father’s house, a place with lots of passersby.  She sets up a table there to sell this seafood and waits for customers to come by looking for fresh fish.  She’s been doing this work for a year and to date has been doing it alone because her spouse works in another department of Perú; he sends her a bit of economic help.

What she likes about her work is that it leaves her with time to be at home doing other things during the afternoon and also because every day she earns good income because her work produces good profits.  She hopes to be able to support herself and perhaps later on open a grocery store at home.

This will be her second MFP loan.  She did well with the previous one and was responsible with her payments.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to increase working capital because that will lead to higher profits.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy fresh fish as well as a few trays and materials to be able to sell her fish more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy more fish and trays.

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en: Bayanmunh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps him with the business and his daughter is a school student. He started his shoe retail business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. He has a good eye for fashion. He is a sharp and hard working man who says, "at first, It was difficult to run a business but now that I am experienced and successful on my current business, I want to broaden a range of products to sale". He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more shoes and clothes from Beijing.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and clothes from Beijing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 50 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 22 y 12 años, el mayor de sus hijos esta en otro país y de ahí envía alguna ayuda económicas a su casa, mientras que la menor de 12 años esta a su lado y vive junto a ella en su casa propia, que pudo tenerlo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. EL trabajo de Gladys consiste en la venta de comida, ella sale por las tardes a partir de las cinco a colocar  mesas, sillas y manteles, para iniciar otro día más con su trabajo que lleva haciendo por mas de cinco años. Además tiene un pequeño puesto de golosinas que le genera un pequeño ingreso adicional, y por quien su hija la ayuda en ese negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para dedicarse a ver a su hija en sus tareas, además de poder estar en su casa. Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene ingresos a diario, por tanto espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien ya que sabe que estar en un grupo comunal es de bastante responsabilidad y ella esta dispuesta a aceptar el reto pues siempre fue muy beuna pagadora y esta vez no será la excepción. Tiene intensiones de trabajar juntos por mucho más tiempo y así poder creer juntos. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, implementará su negocio, comprará golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y algunos ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la elaboración de su comida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 50, is a good, responsible woman.  She lives with her spouse.  They have two children who are 22 and 12 years old.  Her older son is in another country and sometimes sends her a little bit of economic help while the 12-year-old is still at home living with her in her own house that she was able to acquire with much effort and sacrifice.

Gladys’ work consists in selling food.  She goes out every afternoon starting at 5pm to set up tables, chairs and tablecloths to start another day of work, a job she’s been doing for over five years.  She also has a small snack stand that produces additional income and that her daughter helps her with.

What she likes about her work is that she has time to help her daughter with homework and also to be at home.  She is doing well because she earns daily income and hopes later on to enlarge the business.

This will be her first MFP loan and she hopes to do well because she knows that being in a communal group carries a large responsibility and she’s willing to accept the challenge because she’s always been good at paying her debts and this will not be an exception to that.  She intends to continue working together for much more time to be able to grow together.

She will use the requested 600 soles to stock her business; she will buy snacks, soft-drinks and some ingredients and supplies to continue preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food as well as snacks and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Hairolla

texts.en: Hairolla is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her seven-month-old baby and his elder two kids are school students. He started his business in 2004 by trading raw materials (wool, cashmere, etc). He has many regular customers and guaranteed suppliers. He is well known for his fair trading and excellent service. He always looks for new business opportunities. Therefore, this year, he planned to buy livestock from herders and resell it when the price rises during winter time. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock to re-sell

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is 28 years old and lives with her son, a student, in a ger ( Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Otgontsetseg operates photo studio, a business she started in 2003 by renting a workspace uptown. Well-experienced in her field, she is known as the one of the best in the province.

Now that she's operated the business for a long time, her equipment is getting old, reducing the quality of her photographs. Otgontsetseg is therefore requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a  ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband works in the city and stays at home during winter. Her kids are school students. She started her vegetable trading business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. In addition, she plants potatoes in 100m2 (100 square meters). Now that her business is stable enough, she wants to build a small warehouse to broaden her range of products to retail. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "during winter time, vegetable prices will increase therefore, I need to build a small warehouse to store my supplies". She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to build a warehouse.

loans.use: To build a warehouse to store her supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 43 años, es una señora amable y buena, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 6, 4 y 1 años de edad, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus hijos y su conviviente, con quien a diario trabajan mucho para así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. EL trabajo de Antonia consiste en la venta de pescado, ella sale temprano al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los pescados mas grandes y frescos, de ahí sale a la carretera, se va hasta el kilómetro 34 en la localidad de Campoverde y hasta el kilómetro 60 a la localidad de Neshuya, ahí tiene clientes que siempre le esperan para poder comprarle pescado que siempre les da buen precio. Tiene dos años realizando este trabajo y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es libre de manejar su tiempo, además que genera ingresos a diario en su casa. Espera poder consolidar su negocio y poner un almacén de venta de pescado fresco y seco. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, espera poder compenetrarse rápidamente al grupo ya que desea ser desde ahora una socia muy responsable y seguir trabajando juntos. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda, de poder aumentar su capital y promete no decepcionar. Con el monto solicitado 700 soles, comprará pescado y en mayor cantidad, además hielo y algunos materiales mas que necesita para poder seguir haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Antonia, 43, is a kind, good woman.  She has a spouse and four children who are 10, 6, 4 and 1 year old.  She has her own house where she lives with her children and spouse.  She and her spouse work hard together every day to provide a better quality of life for their family.

Antonia’s work consists in selling fish.  She goes out early to the city’s main port looking for the largest, freshest fish.  From there she heads out to the highway and continues all the way to kilometer 34 to the community of Campoverde and then on to kilometer 60 to the community of Neshuya.  She has customers there who always wait for her to buy the fish she sells at good prices.  She’s been doing this work for two years and to date has done it alone.

What she likes about her work is that she’s free to manage her own time and also that it generates daily household income.  She hopes to consolidate the business and open a fresh and dry fish store.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She hopes to quickly integrate into the group because she wants from now to be a very responsible member and to continue working together.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises not to disappoint.  

She will use the requested 700 soles to buy larger amounts of fish as well as ice and some other supplies she needs to continue doing her work.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Maigul

texts.en: Maigul is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her eldest daughter is a college student and the younger two are school students. She started her garment retailing business in 2002. Now, her daily income is 100,000 MNT. Now that winter is approaching, she needs more warm clothes to retail. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Since my business is the only income to the family, I have to do everything I can in order to support my children". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 21 años, es una madre joven, tiene un niño de 4 años. Vive a lado de su pareja con quien es conviviente, tienen una casa propia en la cual trabajan ambos para poder brindan los mejor a su menor hijo. El trabajo de Diana consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, ella tiene una mototaxi el cual alquila a un chofer que trae todos días el costo del alquiler. Ella para en su casa en donde espera todos los días a que su chofer llegue. Tiene dos años en este trabajo, y gracias a ello puede contribuir con los gastos del hogar.  Le gusta de su trabajo que puede tener un ingreso desde su hogar sin tener que descuidar a su hijo. Ella junto a su conviviente generan los ingresos suficientes para poder vivir tranquilos y espera poder mantener su negocio por mientras ya que más adelante le gustaría empezar a vender comida en su casa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece. Agradece mucho esta oportunidad que le dan de aumentar su capital, pues le ayudará mucho en hacer cosas para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 500 soles, comprará materiales para empezar a vender comida, además de ingredientes e insumos, asimismo arreglará algunas piezas de su mototaxi que se deterioraron con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Diana, 21, is a young mother; she has a 4-year-old son.  She lives with her spouse in their own house; they both work to provide the best for their son.

Diana’s work consists in leasing a mototaxi.  She owns a mototaxi that she leases to a driver who pays her a daily rental fee.  She goes by his house every day to wait for him to arrive.  She’s been in this business for two years and thanks to it has been able to contribute towards household expenses.  What she likes about her work is that she’s able to earn money from home not having to neglect her son.  She and her spouse generate enough income to be able to live worry-free and she’d like to stay in business for the time being since later on she’d like to start to sell food at home.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She hopes to be able to pay all her installments on time in order not to disappoint the group she’s part of.  She is very grateful for this opportunity to increase capital because it will help her a lot to do things that will increase her working capital.  She will use the requested 500 soles to buy supplies to start selling food as well as ingredients and raw materials.  She will also repair some of her mototaxi’s parts that have worn down over time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and also to buy a spare part for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en: Oyunbileg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her children are school students. She started her business by planting vegetables. Now she sells the vegetables by renting a counter in the market. However, she doesn't have enough different vegetables to sell. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I grow only potatoes and carrots however they are not enough to sell in the market".  She is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase a variety of seeds to widen the range of products she has to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds

loans.name: Guljainar

texts.en:
Guljainar is 40 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband is a public school teacher and her son goes to kindergarten. She started her clothing sales business in 2002 by selling a small variety of products. Now, she sells all kinds of garments such as shoes, pants, and jackets, and her daily income is 80,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT). 

Now that winter is approaching, Guljainar needs to buy warm clothes to retail. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "I started my business from a scratch, I never thought I would go this far, now that I came here, I have bright vision for my business." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife stays at home with their newborn child. Myagmarsuren started his garment retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. Even though he is fairly new to the business, he has many regular customers. 

Now that winter is approaching, Myagmarsuren wants to sell warm clothes. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "I never thought that my business would be this successful, My products selling like crazy." He is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gashununu 3/sk Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Gashununu no 3/Sk. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Samuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et des grains modernes. Avec les profits, il prévoit de  construire une maison et scolarises ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a part of the group called "Gashununu 3/Sk". He is 32 and married with three children ranging in age from three to seven. One of them is enrolled in school. Emmanuel's educational level is six years of primary school. 

Emmanuel is a rice farmer. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop and to pay for labor. 

His strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilizer and modern seeds. With the profit, he intends to build a house and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for rice crop and pay field hands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for making some repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 30 years old man.  He is married and works as a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Waleed wants to make some necessary repairs to his house such as: painting, changing tiles, etc.  But he lacks the money.  He needs to take a $1,500 loan from FATEN. 

When Waleed gets the loan, and repairs are made, his family will live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for needed repairs to his house.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 21-year-old single man from Ramallah. On March 1st, 2010 Abdullah opened his own business, a cell phone store. His store is different from others because it is on the main street, and many people see the store. With this loan, he will buy new accessories to sell for the cell phones he has in the store.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for the cell phones he has in the store.

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en: Shereen is a 24-year-old married woman from Gaza. She owns a store in which she sells accessories. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy new accessories for her store. She also hopes that once she improves the status of her store, she will be able to help her husband financially as well.

loans.use: To buy new accessories for her store.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en:
Tariq is a 27-year-old single man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and he has his own grocery store.

Tariq is requesting a loan of 1,800 JD to purchase more goods for his store.

Tariq is looking to expand his store and improve his family's living conditions.

Tariq refused to upload his photo, so the man in the photo is his cousin.

loans.use: to purchase goods for the store

loans.name: Bothayna

texts.en:
Bothayna is a 31-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Bothayna has a dairy-making project, which he does from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase sheep and goats.

Bothayna is looking to expand her business by purchasing more goats and sheep so that she can increase her family's income and help with her children's education fees.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to make dairy products

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a 59-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who has one child.

Years ago, An purchased a used sewing machine and started her business sewing clothes. Now she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase a modern sewing machine.

An is looking to improve her business by employing other people and opening her own shop for sewing.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is An's husband.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing mchine and material

loans.name: Hyam

texts.en:
Hyam is a 54-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Hyam is sewing from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase materials for her business such as cloth, thread, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her home-based project.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Sana'a is a 43-year-old single woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is trading in clothes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes for resale. 

Sana'a is looking to improve her family's living conditions through increasing her income.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo, Sana'a's brother, is photographed in her place.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 29-year-old man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Hamad is about to get married so he is requesting a loan of 800 JD to finalize his wedding arrangements.

loans.use: for marriage purposes.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 42-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Fareeda makes pastries, coffee, and prepares "shehsha" (water pipes) out of her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay rent for a new location for her business.

An aspiration of Fareeda's is to open a quiet spot at her new location for "Shehsha" and she is looking also to improve her family's living conditions so that she can provide needed medications for her sick child.

loans.use: to rent a new location for her home-based project.

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en: Fathiya, a 46-year-old housewife and mother of 6 sons and daughters, helps some of the working mothers by taking care of their kids for a few hours during the day and is paid for it.  She also has a few sheep and goats to raise with her husband who has a farm of grain and animal food. What they do is raise and feed the sheep and goats for sale. Now Fathiya has applied for a loan to buy more sheep. Because Fathiya is a conservative person, she asked her son Naser to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Decision De Paulette Group

texts.fr:
Guerlyne  est le coordonnatrice de son groupe Decision

Elle n’est pas marié il a 5 enfants.

Guerlyne habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Elle a dirigé son business pendant les 16 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon.

Guerlyne espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de DECISION ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Guerlyne dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Guerlyne is the coordinator for the Decision group. She is not married but has five children. She lives in the town of Trou in the north of Haiti where electricity is rare and water very limited. She has been running her business for the past 16 years. 

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal. She is hoping that the loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the Decision group need a loan for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish. 

Guerlyne says that her principal objective is to increase her business. Her dream is to buy a motorbike to transport her materials.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 33-year-old single man who opened a small internet café in Al Zarqa three years ago. Through these years, he was able to expand by adding more computers every once in a while. He also has another service that he provides in his store, which is selling computers. Now Ibrahim has applied for this loan to buy more PCs and design a new front sign for the café.

loans.use: to buy more computers and design a new front sign for the café

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: La Estancia (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por nueve socias y un socio quienes son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido, trabajan en diferentes actividades y en especial en trabajos del campo, como se desempeñan en diferentes actividades estas les permiten aportar a la economía de su hogar y salir  adelante con sus familias. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute (Cuenca), cantón que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes y tiene varios lugares para visitar, su clima que es muy cálido, tiene variedad en su gastronomía típica y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Janeth, tiene 27 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Janeth se desempeña en cualquier trabajo que le den ya que hay días que le llaman a trabajar en la agricultura, pelando pollos o cualquier otro trabajo. En su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para ampliar su criadero.
 
Su meta es tener un galpón mas grande de cuyes.
texts.en:
The members of the La Estancia communal bank, nine women and one man, are agreeable, gentle, and warm-hearted people.  They work in different jobs, especially agricultural work.  Since they work in various activities, they are able to contribute to the household economy and get ahead with their families.  They live in the environs of Paute canton (Cuenca), a canton known for its beautiful landscape, several places to visit, warm climate, variety in its typical cuisine, and people who maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is Janeth, 27.  She lives with her common-law husband and has conceived two children, ages 6 and 4, who study in a school in the community.  Her husband works as a private employee, and the house in which she lives is her own property.
 
Janeth does whatever job she is given, since there are days when she works in agriculture, plucking chickens or any other job.  At home she works raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, and with her new loan she will buy guinea pigs to expand her breeding.
 
Her goal is to have a larger guinea pig shed.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 13, 5 años y el ultimo de 8 meses; ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su pareja y sus tres menores hijos. EL trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la costura, se dedica a la confección de sus propios diseños y a la costura de otras personas, ella se adapta a la temporada, y a lo que desean los clientes, ya que vende ropa para niños, lencería para señoritas, ropa de mujer, etc. tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo sola por 10 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene independencia con su tiempo además que tiene buenas ganancia y le considera muy rentable, le esta yendo bien ya que gana muy bien además de tener ingresos a diaR.; desea mas adelante poder tener un taller mas grande con maquinas industriales poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres que necesitan. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que los del banco comunal le den un buen trato y así puedan seguir siendo fuertes como hasta ahora, tiene muchas expectativas ya que sabe que estar en este grupo es de mucha responsabilidad y no quisiera fallar a sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado 700 soles, comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo, además ella tiene en su poder un ahorro de 500 soles y mas los 700 que le están prestando, podrá comprar una recubridora para darle mejor acabado a sus prendas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old. She is a very happy, dynamic and responsible woman. She lives with her partner. They have three children who are 13 years old, 5 years old and 8 months. She has her own home and she lives with her partner and their three young children. Rosa works in dressmaking. She creates clothing with her own designs and sewing for other people. She adapts to the season and to what her customers want. She now sells children’s clothing, lingerie, women’s clothing, etc. She has a studio in her home. She has been doing this work for ten years. What she likes about her work is that she has independence with her time. In addition, she likes that she earns good profits. She considers her business to be profitable. The business is doing very well and she is earning income every day. In the future, she wants to have a bigger shop with industrial machines in order to offer work to other women who need to work. 
This will be he her first loan with the MFP organization. She hopes that the communal bank will give her a good deal and that it will continue doing well like now. She has lots of expectations since she now knows that the group has a lot of responsibility and does not want its members to fail. With the requested loan of 700 soles, she will purchase materials in order to continue with her work. In addition, she already has 500 soles in saving. With the additional 700 soles, she will be able to purchase a sewing machine to better finish her garments.

loans.use: purchase dressmaking materials and a machine to better finish her garments.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 59 años, es una señora buena y muy responsable, esta casada y junto a su esposo son padres de dos hijos, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su esposo y de sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores y aportan mucha ayuda en su hogar.

EL trabajo de Yolanda, consiste en la elaboración y venta de tamales, ella desde temprano se pone a elaborar sus productos en su hogar, de ahí por las tardes junto a su esposo salen a vender por las calles en la mototaxi de su esposo, tiene buena acogida pues ya lleva cinco años haciendo este trabajo y tienes sus fieles clientes que esperan que pase por su calle para comprarle sus deliciosos tamales que da con su riquísima salsa de cebolla y un pedazo de yuca cocinada.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite descansar mucho casi todo el día, ya que por las noches nomás sale a vender, además tiene buenos ingresos pues como ya saben que tiene muy beuna sazón las personas los esperan con ansias para poder comprar su delicioso tamal para la cena, espera poder tener un puesto mas adelante en donde pueda vender su tamal al por mayor y poner una bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien ya que la primera vez le fue todo bien ya que no se atraso ni una sola cuota de su pago, esta muy feliz de trabajar con su grupo por que demostraron ser responsables y además menciona que quiere seguir trabajando con la institución por que le dan la oportunidad de tener mayor capital y eso es bueno para su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mercadería para poner una bodega en su casa ya que esta iniciando en este negocio que le permitirá tener mayor ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 59, is a good and very responsible woman.  She is married, and she and her husband are the parents of two children.  She has her own house where she lives alongside her husband and two children, who are grown already and contribute a lot in the home.

Yolanda works making and selling tamales.  She begins very early making her products at home, and then in the afternoon she and her husband go out to sell them in the street in her husband's motorcycle taxi.  She is favorably received since she has been doing this job for five years and she has loyal customers who wait for her to pass by on their streets so they can buy her delicious tamales with her delicious onion salsa and a bit of cooked yucca.  

What she likes about her job is that it allows her to rest a lot throughout the day, since she only goes out at night to sell.  Besides, she has a good income since people eagerly wait for her so they can buy her delicious tamales, since they already know that they have an excellent flavor.  She hopes to be able to have a stall in the future where she can sell her tamales wholesale and open a grocery store in her house.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She hopes that it goes well for her, since the first time everything went well because she wasn't late on a single payment.  She is very happy to work with her group because they showed themselves to be responsible.  She also mentions that she wants to continue working with the institution because they give her the opportunity to have greater capital and this is good for her work.

With the requested loan of 1000 PEN she will buy merchandise to open a store in her house, since she is starting this business that will allow her to have greater income for her home.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo José y sus 2 hijos: Claudio y Mayela, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Hace poco cerro su locutorio, donde brindaba el servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Por motivo de falta de capital de trabajo, tuvo que cerrar. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar una suma considerable de dinero gracias a su esposo, que trabaja en una empresa de autos como mecánico. Con ello compraron un auto, que alquilan para el trasporte público; diario le pagan 30 nuevos soles por el servicio. Este negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque no necesita mucho mantenimiento, pues su esposo mantiene en perfecta condición, cambiando el aceite y revisando constantemente el auto. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para volver a abrir su primer negocio, donde está segura el ira muy bien. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimocuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Margarita de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en repuestos para arreglar su auto.
texts.en: Margarita, 35, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Jose, and their 2 children, Claudio and Mayela, in a house they own in Tambo.  Margarita closed her locutorio business--where she sold phone services--a while back because she didn't have enough capital to keep it going.  She has managed to save a bit of money since then with help from her husband who is an auto mechanic.  She used the money to buy a car that she leases for use as a taxi.  The driver pays her 30 new soles a day for the lease, income that helps to pay household expenses.  The car doesn't require a lot of maintenance because her husband keeps it in perfect condition.  He changes the car's oil and checks it regularly for problems.  Now she wants to pull together enough money to re-open her first business because she is sure it will be a big success this time.  Margarita belongs to the IDME community bank and this is her twenty-fourth MFP loan.  She hopes you will help her to continue working toward her goals.  She has a record of repaying her loans and is committed to repaying this one.  Margarita likes being a member of the community bank because its members are responsible and supportive.  She will use this loan to buy spare parts for her car-leasing business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her car-leasing business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta, de 41 años es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Emiliano, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Helen a la que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Quebrada imperial Acostambo.  Con un capital de trabajo de 2 mil soles, está mujer sale adelante por el futuro de su familia. Pues todos los viernes, viaja a la ciudad a comprar productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles y tiene buena acogida, ya que es la única tienda del anexo. Pero como el lugar donde vive es algo alejado. Aprovecha los viernes, cuando viaja a la feria; en vender sus animales, entre ovejas y cerdos. Los cuales enseba con mucho cuidado y dedicación. Ya que obtiene buenas ganancias en ellos. Además cuenta que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, su principal cultivo es de maca. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, se dirige a cuidar de sus sembríos pues, el producto es muy cotizado y tiene que cuidarlo con dedicación y esmero. Ahora planean sembrar nuevamente naca y están seguros que tendrán mucho éxito. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los puquiales” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP. Agradece el apoyo brindado en todo este tiempo y espera de un nuevo préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Modesta de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 5 kilos de semilla de maca, para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Modesta, 41, is a modest, hard-working woman.  She and her husband, Emiliano, have been together for 5 years and have a daughter, Helen.  The family lives in a house they own in the rural town of Quebrada.  With working capital of only 2,000 soles, Modesta is building a better future for her family.  She goes to town on Fridays to buy merchandise for her general store, the only one for miles around.  She goes on Fridays because there's a market in the town that day.  She buys her animals at the market--sheep and pigs, for example--animals that she raises with a lot of care and dedication because they are an important source of income for her.  She says that her husband is a farmer and his most important crop is maca.  Every morning, very early, he goes out to his fields to tend the crop, taking great care because maca is very valuable.  They are now planning another maca crop and they are sure it will be a big success.  Modesta belongs to the Los Puquiales community bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She is grateful for the help she has received from the bank in the past and expects that the new loan will help her meet her goals.  She is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the loan to buy 5 kilos of maca seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy 5 kilos of maca seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 57 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive con sus 2 hijos: Juan y Raquel en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Chilca. Gracias a su constancia, ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos. Pues trabaja en varias actividades. De lunes a viernes, vende ropa de toda variedad, color y tamaño a los pobladores de su zona. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de casa en casa, pues no cuenta con una tienda o lugar específico en donde la puedan encontrar. Pero más adelante espera alquilar un espacio en la zona céntrica de la ciudad. Asimismo los fines de semana, vende mazamorra en la feria grande que se realiza en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Como sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, continúa trabajando sin descanso, pues desea ver a sus hijos realizados y con aspiraciones. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimoquinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. María, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa y juguetes para las festividades por navidad.
texts.en: Maria, 57, is a single mother.  She lives with her 2 children, Juan and Rachel, in a rented house in the district of Chilca.  Thanks to her hard work, she has managed to provide for her children.  She earns a living doing more than one thing.  From Mondays to Fridays, she sells all kinds of clothing, in every size and color.  She goes door to door to sell her merchandise because she doesn't have a store or a fixed place where she could operate the business.  She hopes that she can rent a space one day, somewhere in the city center.  At weekends, she earns extra income selling mazamorra--a traditional maize-based desert--at the largest market in Huancayo.  She knows that hard work is rewarded, so she works and works, without stop, because she wants to provide her children with everything they need.  Maria is a member of the IDME community bank and this is her twenty-fifth MFP loan.  She asks that you help her meet her goals and she, in turn, is committed to repaying this loan as promptly as she has repaid past loans.  She likes her community bank because the members are responsible and supportive.  She will use this loan to buy clothes and toys for the coming Christmas season.

loans.use: Comprar ropa y juguetes.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
De apariencia débil pero de personalidad segura y emprendedora, Norma de 40 años vive casada con Héctor de 48 años con quién tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo vive con 4. Todos ellos habitan un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini.

Norma trabaja la tierra desde niña sembrando café, plata y achiote, productos que le han dado a ella y a su familia el sustento necesario hasta el momento; ya que cuentan con 2 parcelas y media de terreno, priorizando la plantación de café. Por su parte, Héctor su esposo se dedica de lleno a la agricultura, mientras ella trabaja en una embolsadora de café, en donde recibe un sueldo mensual, de esa manera percibe más ingresos. Y como si fuera poco, Norma vende los domingos vende comida en su casa. “A pesar de ser pequeñas, de mis parcelas obtengo 3 sacos de café y cada uno tiene 120 kilos, los vendemos por latas, cada lata pesa 2 kilos y su precio por ahora es de 6 soles, hay meses que se vende al doble, si nos conviene”, explica Norma. Mas adelante, ella quisiera verse morar en un hogar con más comodidades y de infraestructura más concisa y duradera, por ejemplo instalar un servicio de desagüe y colocar un lavadero, como prioridad, para eso seguirá trabajando como ahora. Con su ayuda, Norma podrá obtener su crédito número 4 de MFP, por lo que ella asegura pagará puntualmente cada mes, como lo estaba haciendo, junto a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal del que se siente tranquila, por que todos colaboran y saben organizarse. Con el dinero del préstamo, Norma comprará fierros, bolsas de cemento y ladrillos para empezar la construcción de las primeras paredes de su nuevo hogar, para eso, Héctor tendrá que distribuir su tiempo para construirla y no descuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
She may appear weak but 40-year-old Norma has a secure and entrepreneurial personality.  Norma is married to 48-year-old Héctor and has seven children, only four of whom still live with her.  They live together in their own home, in the indigenous community of Pucharini.

Norma has been working the land since she was a girl, growing coffee, bananas and annatto, products which have provided both her and her family with the support they need up to now.  They have two and a half plots of land and prioritize the planting of coffee.  Héctor, Norma's husband, farms full time whilst Norma works for a coffee packing company which pays her a monthly salary.  This makes her more income.  As if that weren't enough, Norma also sells food from her home on Sundays.  "Despite the fact that my plots of land are small, I obtain three 120kg sacks of coffee from them.  We sell the coffee by the can.  Each can weighs 2 kilos and the price right now is 6 soles.  There are months when we sell for double that if we agree on it", explains Norma.

In the future, Norma would like to live in a home with more comforts and more concise and hard-wearing infrastructure.  For example, she will have sewerage service installed and put in a sink as a priority.  In order to achieve this, she will continue working as she has up to now.  With your help, Norma will be able to obtain her fourth loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments on time each month as she has been doing, together with the other members of her community bank.  Norma feels comfortable being part of her community bank because everybody cooperates and they know how to organize themselves.  Norma will use her loan money to buy iron, bags of cement and bricks so that she can start building the first walls of her new home.  In order to do this, Héctor will have to divide his time so that he can build the house without neglecting his crops.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and iron

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly de 23 años de edad convive hace 9 años con Iván, su pareja de 25 años, con quién tuvo 2 hijos ahora de 6 y 3 años. Los 4 viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini. Magaly e Iván se dedican a la agricultura desde que empezaron a convivir, con la siembra de café, plátanos, frutas cítricas, papayas, yucas y cocona. A parte de eso Magaly prepara anticuchos y los vende por las noches en la puerta de su hogar. Por su parte Iván, cuando no está en el campo, trabaja en construcción civil de carreteras y obras públicas. Por la lejanía de sus terrenos, el acceso para llegar sus cosechas, dificulta y demora el traslado de las mismas, por esa razón no dudan al momento de contratar personal, siendo para ellos uno de sus principales obstáculos dentro de su actividad. Más adelante le gustaría abrir un negocio en el que compre plátanos al por mayor de los comuneros de su zona e introducirlos en la ciudad de Lima para venderlos a mayor precio. Haciendo sus cálculos lo considera rentable. Éste sería su préstamo número 4 de MFP, que se concretizará gracias a su ayuda, por su parte Magaly se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y trabajar de la mano con la entidad y su banco comunal del que se siente respaldada y confiada.
Con el crédito, Magaly comprará semillas de cítricos como naranjas, tangellos y limones. Para sus parcelas  de papayas comprará 5 sacos de abonos con 700 soles, con el dinero restante pagará el servicio de operarios.
texts.en:
Magaly is 23 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with Iván, her 25-year-old partner. They have two children who are now 6 and 3 years of age. The four of them live in their own home in their native community of Pucharini. Magaly and Iván have been farming since they have been together. They grow coffee, bananas, citrus fruits, papayas, cassava, and coconuts. In addition, Magaly prepares grilled meats and then sells them in the evenings from the doorstep of her home. When he is not working in the fields, Iván works in highway construction and on other public projects. Due to the distance it takes to get to their land, accessing and transporting their crops can be difficult and result in delays. For this reason, they do not hesitate to hire workers since this is one of the main obstacles of this business. Going forward, Magaly would like to open a business selling bananas in bulk from the local villagers and introducing them into the city of Lima where she can sell them at a higher price. By her calculations, this venture would be profitable.

This would be her fourth loan with MFP once she receives everyone’s support. Magaly promises to complete her payments on time and work hand-in-hand with the organization and her Communal Bank, where she feels supported and trusted. With this loan, Magaly will buy citrus fruit seeds for oranges, tangelos, and lemons. For her parcels of papayas, she will buy five sacks of compost for 700 PEN. The rest of the money will be used to pay for the services of workers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit seeds, sacks of compost, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Areli de 24 años de edad, es una madre soltera de un hijo de 7 años a quien dedica su vida y trabajo. Vive solo con su mamá, en la comunidad de Pucharini. Con el dinero que recibe de la mantención de su ex pareja, Areli puede darle a su pequeño hijo una educación decente, pero como es consciente que al pasar el tiempo siempre surgen nuevas necesidades se encargó de hacer producir las parcelas de sus padres, en ellas siembra paltas, café y plátanos. A la vez cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes, verduras, gaseosas y demás productos los que vende en una bodega instalada en la casa de su madre. “Ambas actividades son rentables, la siembra cada lapso de tiempo produce bien, mientas tanto de la tienda obtengo dinero para el gasto diario”, explica. Para el futuro, Areli piensa ampliar su negocio con productos más surtidos y producir en mayor cantidad, de esa manera ella podrá brindarle a su hijo mayores oportunidades de educación, “uno de mis sueños es tener mi casa propia y formar una familia cariñosa”, cuenta entre risas. Con fe, éste sería su préstamo número 4 de MFP, para eso Areli necesita de su ayuda, por su parte, ella se compromete a ser firme y puntual en sus cuotas, al igual que sus compañeros del banco comunal llamado “Trabajadores de Pucharini”, del que se siente muy a gusto. Una vez que el dinero del crédito llegue a sus manos, logrará comprar semillas de café y plátanos, así como para iniciar un nuevo cultivo de yucas. Cone el dinero restante pagará el servicio de flete y personal para que limpien sus parcelas de malas hierbas.
texts.en:
Areli is 24 years old and a single mother of a seven-year-old son. For this reason, she dedicates herself to her life and work. Areli lives with her mother in the community of Pucharini and receives financial support from her ex-partner so that her young son can have a decent education. Since she is aware that new needs arise over time, Areli took charge of her parents’ land so that she could plant avocados, coffee, and bananas. She also has a business selling groceries, vegetables, sodas, and other products from her mother’s house. “Both activities are profitable. Planting crops produces good results each time, but the store generates income for daily expenses,” explains Areli. In the future, she plans to expand her business by being well-stocked with more merchandise and producing crops in greater volume so that she can provide her son more educational opportunities. “One of my dreams is to have my own home and to raise a loving family,” she says with laughter. With faith, Areli promises to be steadfast and punctual with her payments, just like her fellow members of the Communal Bank called “Trabajadores de Pucharini” (Workers of Pucharini). She feels very comfortable with her group.

Once the money is in her hands, Areli will buy coffee and banana seedlings and also start a new crop of cassava. The rest of the money will be used to pay workers to remove weeds from her parcels of land.

loans.use: to buy coffee and banana seedlings and to pay workers to remove weeds.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 45 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 7 años de edad la misma que estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Ella es una gran comerciante ya que aprendió desde muy joven esta profesión, tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa en el cual vende ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos, entre muchas otras cosas, además de estos productos también en su local sus clientes pueden encontrar útiles escolares, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, este negocio lo heredo de su mamá y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para invertir en su negocio quiere comprar peluches, ropa, zapatos, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal ya por 4 ciclos, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable.
 
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal 20 De Abril (20th of April Communal Bank) meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for artisans recognized on the national and international level. The place is also famous for Panama hats. Here we meet señora Ana, age 45 and married. They have a 7 year old daughter who goes to school. Her husband is privately employed.

Ana is a great saleswoman, having learned this trade when she was very young. She has a small variety store in her home in which she sells clothing, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics, among many other things. In addition to these products, in her shop customers can also find school supplies. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She inherited this business from her mother, and it is doing very well.

This loan will be invested in her business. She wants to purchase felt toys, clothing, and shoes, among other things. She has been in the communal bank for 4 cycles and is the treasurer. She likes it because the group is united and reliable. Her dream is to have her business grow more each day.

loans.use: to purchase felt toys, clothing, shoes, and other inventory.

loans.name: Emma Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
