En este lugar conocimos a la señora Emma, tiene 39 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 16 años de edad la misma que estudia en  colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan en la  institución con los créditos.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño puesto en el centro de Montecristi en el cual todas las mañana se dedican a vender deliciosos encebollados (plato típico), ellos venden hasta cien platos por día ya que cuentan con buena clientela los mismos que los prefieren por la sazón que le dan a sus platos y por la buena atención que ofrecen. Tienen tres años con su negocio y les ha ido muy bien y mucho mejor desde que reciben los créditos de la Fundación Espoir.

Este crédito es comprar pescado, yuca, sodas, entre otros víveres para preparar los platos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
The  "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton, Portoviejo province. This is an area known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts, that are recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is where we met Emma, who is 39, and married. She and her husband have  a 16 year-old daughter who goes to high school. Her husband is a small business owner. She has been with the communal bank for four loan cycles, and likes it because of the help the institution provides through loans. 

She and her husband have a small food stall in the central part of Montecristo, where they sell delicious encebollado (traditional fish stew made with onion and yucca). They sell up to 100 plates a day, as they have a good base of customers, who prefer them for the flavor they give to their dishes and the good service they provide. 

They've had their business for three years, and it's gone very well for them; and much better since they began receiving the loans from Fundación Espoir. 

This loan will be used for buying fish, yucca, soft drinks, and other foodstuffs for making their dishes. Their dream is to have a large place of business, so that they can offer better service.

loans.use: To buy fish, yucca, soft drinks and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Melba Ernestina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Melba, tiene 55 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo una hija la misma que ya es mayor de edad y aun vive con ella.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y para que a sus hija no le faltara nada desde hace 8 años y con unos pocos recursos que tenia empezó un  negocio de venta de ropa, el mismo que sigue teniendo hasta la actualidad, ahora también está vendiendo productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) esto es lo  que le ha servido para subsistir honradamente, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres días por semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y cosméticos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es excelente. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "20 de Abril" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo), known for its rich precolonial culture and craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and around the world. It is famous for Panama hats made of palm fiber. 

Here we meet Melba, 55, separated, and a mother of one grown daughter who still lives with her. 

In order to earn a living, and make sure that her daughter didn't lack for anything, she took what few resources she had and started a business 8 years ago selling clothing. She still has the same business today, and is now also selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories). This has helped her to sustain herself honorably. She sells her products door-to-door, working 3 days a week. She leaves items on credit and collects payment on the weekend. 

This loan will help her to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, shirts and Avon cosmetics. She has been with the village bank since the beginning, is the president of the group and likes it because the group is excellent. 

Her dreams are to continue moving forward with her business and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts and Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Laura Betzabe

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a Laura, tiene 23 años  de edad, está soltera y  estudia  el quinto semestre de Agroindustria en una Universidad de Manta. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella para generar sus propios recursos puso un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de repuestos para carros, como su casa está muy cerca de un taller mecánico tiene muy buenas ventas, trabaja todos los días por las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ir a la Universidad, pero en las tardes su papá se queda en el negocio hasta la noche. Recién tiene 6 meses con su negocio y le está yendo bastante bien.

Este crédito es para  comprar repuestos y refacciones de automóviles. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo empezar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts, recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is where we met Laura, who is 23, and single. She is in her fifth semester of Agroindustry at the University of Manta.

She doesn't have her own house, so she lives in her parents' house. To generate her own resources, she set up a small shop in her house, where she sells every kind of spare part for cars. Because her house is very close to an auto repair shop, she has very good sales. 

She works every day in the mornings, since in the afternoons she has to go to the University. But in the afternoons, her dad stays in the shop until the evening. She has only had her business for six months, and it's going quite well.

This loan is for buying spare parts for automobiles. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because with the loans she was able to start her business. Her dream is to finish her studies and be a professional

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 22 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 4  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y la menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatillas y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende útiles escolares y helados, ella sale tres días a la semana a vender sus productos aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su local, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante  bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que se acercan las fiestas y  en esta temporada se vende bastante de estos productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is where we met Rosa, who is 22, and married. She and her husband have two children, ages six and four. The eldest goes to primary school, and the youngest is in nursery school. Her husband is a construction worker.

She is a housewife, who in order to earn her own income, sells clothing, footwear, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories).  In addition, she has a small shop in her home where she sells school supplies and ice cream.

She goes out three days a week to sell her products, although she carries out most of her sales at her shop. She sells her products on credit, and collects every weekend. She has been doing this for five years, and it's going quite well.  

This loan is to buy clothing and footwear, as the holidays are approaching, and in this season you sell quite a lot of these products. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Irlanda Marilux

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Irlanda,  tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero adema de esto ella también se dedica al comercio, vede ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en la escuela y los fines de semana se dedican a vender sus productos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, también vende en su lugar de trabajo. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque la unión que hay en el grupo. 

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is the place where Irlanda lives. She is 59 years old, and is in a common-law relationship. They have three children, three of them adults, and one still living at home. Her husband is a shopkeeper. She is a teacher in the local school, but in addition to this, she also has a business selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). 

She works every day, since from Monday to Friday she works at the school, and on weekends she sells her products. She sells her products on credit, and collects every two weeks. She also sells in her workplace. She has been doing this for six years, and it's going very well. This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing of every kind. 

This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the unity in the group. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Mariela Yasmina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y de 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
 
Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vede ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, trabaja a base de pedidos que le realiza sus clientes. Ella visita a sus clientes tres  días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas, deja a deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Lleva 7 meses con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  4 ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal 20 De Abril (April 20 Communal Bank) meets every 15 days in Montecristo Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for artisans recognized on the national and international level, and also famous for Panama hats. Here we meet Señora Mariela, age 26 and in a common law relationship in which she has two children, ages 8 and 1. The older child is in school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In addition to being a fine housewife, Sra. Mariela has a business selling clothing of all types. She sells door-to-door and also sells to customers who come to her house. She works on the basis of orders from her customers. She visits her customers three days a week, usually in the mornings. She extends credit and collects payment every 15 days. She has had her business for 7 months and is doing rather well.

She is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 4 loan cycles. She likes it because thanks to one of the loans she was able to begin her business.

Her dream is to have her own house. Her current home is rented.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jhanaeth Judid

texts.es:
La Señora Jhanaeth es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas, vive por la parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), este  lugar es de clima frió, cuenta con grandes llanuras que son propicias para la ganadería, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido.

Doña Jhanaeth tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 12, 11, 9, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos no están estudiando ya que no les gusta y sus otros tres hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el trabajo que le ofrezcan, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Jhanaeth se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños y como pasa en casa cría y vende pollos y cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito en  el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos. 

Su meta es de tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Sra. Jhanaeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women). She lives in the parish of Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), a place with a frigid climate. There are wide open plains that are conducive to raising livestock. The people have maintained the culture and traditions of their towns. They are friendly people who have very warm hearts.

Doña Jhanaeth is 33 years old, married, and has six children (ages 12, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3). Her two oldest children are not studying because they don’t enjoy it. The next three children attend a school in the city. Her husband works at a job that was offered to him. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Sra. Jhanaeth devotes herself to taking care of her children since they are still young. She also spends time at home raising and selling chickens and pigs. Jhanaeth is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: María Libia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas, vive por la parroquia San Joaquín (Cuenca), este lugar se caracteriza por sus verdes campos en los cuales muestran el trabajo de su gente  siendo este un lugar de grandes producciones agrícolas, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y al comercio, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 11, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedicaba al cuidado de su hogar pero hace un mes inició  el negocio de venta de animales domésticos, trabaja de domingo a domingo en esta actividad sin horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para mascotas y de animales domésticos.

Su meta es tener un almacén de mascotas de raza.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women). She lives in the parish of San Joaquín (Cuenca), a place known for its green fields. The people who live in this area have demonstrated in their work that they are capable of large-scale agricultural production. They spend their time raising animals, farming, and engaging in trade while maintaining the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña María is 30 years old, married, and has four children (ages 11, 9, 5, and 3). Her oldest child is in middle school and the next two attend an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They own the house in which they live.

Sra. María devotes her time to taking care of the home, but she started one month ago a business of selling domesticated animals. She works Sunday through Sunday in this activity, but she does not have a set schedule. María is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of clothing for pets and domesticated animals. Her goal is to have a pet store.

loans.use: to buy clothing for pets and domesticated animals.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a barber shop. He has been operating his barber shop for the past 10 years, and Asma is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business that will earn him more profits and improve the living standard of her family. Her husband provides hair cutting, shaving, and beauty services to his customers. With the loan, he will buy scissors, razors, shaving gels, and beauty products, such as face creams, that will allow him to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. 

Asma is 26 years old and recently married; she has no child yet. She is a very active person and provides full support to her family. She is also a beautician and operates a beauty parlor at her home. She provides her services to the ladies of her community at reasonable rates. She is especially popular for her bridal makeup. In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asma.

loans.use: to buy required items for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Sadaqat's Group

texts.en:
A talented 41-year-old lady, Sadaqat makes paper envelopes to support her husband in his paper envelope-making and selling business. Her husband has several different contacts to whom he supplies his material and earns better profits. 

Sadaqat is the mother of 3 sons. Her eldest son has a business of making artificial jewelry, while her second son is a butcher. Her third son is free nowadays. 

Sadaqat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy paper and gum, in bulk, for making larger quantities of paper envelopes and increase his sales and profits. Her husband has been operating his business for the past 15 years and is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the living standard of the family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sadaqat.

loans.use: to buy paper and gum for paper envelope-making business

loans.name: Umut's Group

texts.en:
Umut is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married to a retiree. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and two daughters. All the children are married and live with their families. Umut works as a cleaner in the local school. Three years ago with an initial investment of 6000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Umur, with the help of her husband, started to breed livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening, the family earns an additional 1000 KGS per month.  With money received from the loan, Umut wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anarhan's Group

texts.en:
Anarhan is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up three daughters; two older daughters study at university and the younger daughter is at school. In order to earn money for their livelihood, the family breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. They have been running this business since 1994. By reselling livestock after fattening and selling some part of the harvest, they earn about 5000 Kyrgyzsstan soms (KGS) per month. With money received from the loan, Anarhan wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб родился в городе Душанбе в семье служащего. В 1997 году поступил в школу и отлично закончил ее в 2008 году. После окончания школы он поступил в Технологических Университет Таджикистана, в настоящее время является студентом третьего курса. Он активный и целеустремленный юноша, участвует во всех молодежный студенческих мероприятиях. Сухроб запрашивает займ для оплаты годового обучения. Сухроб заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Suhrob was born in the city of Dushanbe, into a military family.  He started school in 1997 and finished it with excellence in 2008.  After finishing school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan Technology University, where he is currently a third-year student.  He is an active and goal-oriented young man, who participates in all of the youth student events.  Suhrob is requesting this loan to pay for one year of studies.  He thanks you in advance for your support and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Dushekan's Group

texts.en:
Dushekan is the leader of this group. She is 55 and unfortunately she is a widow. This brave woman has raised five daughters. The youngest daughter studies at school and all the other daughters are married and live with their families. Four years ago, Dushekan’s daughters presented her two farm animals and since that moment Dushekan has been engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from this loan she wants to increase the number of cattle she breeds. In the near future she plans to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
A talented 46-year-old lady, Zubaida operates a sewing business in her home. She does this work to support her family financially. She is the mother of four children: one daughter and three sons. All of her sons are electricians by profession while her daughter stays at home and supports Zubaida in completing her sewing work. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He sells scrap to different scrap dealers and factories for a profit. He has been in this business for many years.
 
She is requesting a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine because currently she has one which is not enough for her and her daughter to complete their work. She is hopeful that with the additional machine, they both will be able to receive more orders and finish them on time. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mavludahon's Group

texts.en:
Mavludahon is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a baker. With her husband, she brings up three children. Their older daughter works in a sewing workshop and the sons study at school. 

Fifteen years ago, Mavludahon and her husband started baking bread. At the moment their family business runs well, and their monthly profit is about 12000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS). This profit made them possible to purchase furniture and to improve the family’s living conditions. With money received from this loan, Mavludahon wants to repair the roof of her bakery. In the near future she plans to celebrate her daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To repair the roof of her bakery.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша умная и активная девушка. Она студентка 4-го курса экономического факультета Национального Университета Таджикистана. Она учится хорошо и участвует во всех студенческих мероприятиях. Она родилась в районе Файзобод в семье рабочих. Её отец работает водителем на птицефабрике, а ее мать работает поваром в школе. В семье восемь детей. Бунафша запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bunafsha is an intelligent and energetic young woman. She is in her fourth year of studies at the Economics Department of the National University of Tajikistan. She is a good student and takes part in all student activities. She was born in the Faizobod region in a working-class family. Her father is a driver at a poultry factory farm, and her mother works as a school cook. There are eight children in the family. Bunafsha is requesting a loan in order to pay for her studies. She thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a constructor. With her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son, and both children study at school. 

Gulzat works as a teacher in the local school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 3000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), she purchased two farm animals and since that time she has been engaged in livestock breeding. By reselling livestock after fattening, she earns an additional 1500 soms to meet the family's needs. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aijan's Group

texts.en:
Aijan is the leader of this group. She is 52 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised three sons, all of whom are married and live separately with their families.

Twenty years ago, with an initial investment of 12,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), Aijan started to breed cattle. By selling the dairy products and some livestock, she earns about 7,000 soms per month. With money received from this loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the near future she plans to enlarge a shed to be able to keep more animals.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun is 44 years old with five children. She is a farmer, and she also raises ducks and chickens. Sometimes, she works as a construction worker with her children for additional income. Her youngest child is still in school. Khoeun has been a farmer for 20 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to use for rice cultivation and harvest and also to buy feed for her ducks and chickens. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to feed her ducks and chickens to be healthy and fat to earn more income to feed her family. She hopes to build some savings and also to keep her youngest kid in school.

loans.use: To cultivate and harvest rice paddies and also to buy feed for ducks and chickens.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kulnur's Group

texts.en:
Kulnur is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a taxi driver. With her husband, she has raised four sons and two daughters. Their two younger sons study at school and the other children are married and live separately with their families. 

Kulnur is engaged in cattle breeding; she started this activity 30 years ago with an initial investment of 3000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS). She has a lot of experience in this activity, and with the profits gained from selling the dairy products and reselling animals Kulnur was able to purchase a vehicle for her husband. 

With money received from this loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the future she plans to finish the construction of a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nestan's Group

texts.en:
Nestan is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a taxi driver. They have three children. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 4,000 soms, she purchased two farm animals, and since that time she has been engaged in livestock breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening them earns her about 1,500 soms to meet her family's needs. Nestan wants to increase the number of livestock she owns, but she needs additional money to realize her plans; for this purpose she has applied for the loan. In the future, she wishes to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru: Бутон талантливая и умная женщина. Она замужем и у них четверо детей. Её муж занимается услугами перевозки людей на местном городе. Бустон занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев и вышивки. Она также делает реставрации юбки, брюки и пальто. Данный бизнес начала в 2002 году с собственными денежными средствами. Она работала на рынке «Рохи - Абрешим» имела ателье. Бустон хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000$  США для покупки тканей и фурнитуры, для шитья женских национальных платьев для продажи.
texts.en: Buston is a talented and smart woman.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband provides a service of transporting people in the local town.  Buston is involved in sewing women's national dresses and embroidery.  She also provides alteration services for skirts, pants and coats.  She started this business in 2002 with her own monetary funds.  Buston worked at the "Rohi-Abreshim" market and had a boutique there.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of fabrics and accessories in order to make women's national dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and accessories

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Ранохон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 55 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Она предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем. Она принимает заказы на дому. В этой области Ранохон уже восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения цветных ниток, однотонных материалов и тканей.
texts.en: Ranokhon lives in the region of Tursun-zoda. She is 55 years old. She is divorced, with one child. She provides sewing services. She takes orders out of her home. She has been working in this business for eight years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy threads in various colors and solid-color  fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads in various colors and solid-color fabrics.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with 4 children, all are currently enrolled in school. His wife is a homemaker. For the past 4 years, Suleiman has run his own general store. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Suleiman will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans and other goods. Suleiman aspires to start his own wholesale business in the future. He joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans and other goods

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun, a 44-year-old mother of three, one of whom is still in school, is a farmer who also raises chickens and ducks. As well, she sometimes works in construction with two of her children.

A farmer for almost 24 years, this will be her second loan with VisionFund which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland and feed for her chickens and ducks. Oeun hopes the loan will help to increase her crop yield and enable her chickens and ducks to be healthy and fat, resulting in more income to feed her family, save for the future and allow her youngest child to continue in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and poultry feeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is married and raising two young children, with one currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a driver and Philis operates a vegetable stall. She's worked in this business for 3 years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Philis’ greatest challenge is keeping her perishable products fresh for long enough to sell. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Philis will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase cabbages, onions, potatoes and other stock. In the future, Philis aspires to become a local supplier for vegetable products. She joined Yehu because their requirements are fair and products meet her needs.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, onions, potatoes and other stock

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is a 31 year-old farmer with 2 children. She also raises chicken and ducks for additional income. Her oldest child is still in school while her youngest one is not in school yet. She has been a farmer for 10 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Sophea requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her chickens and ducks. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and feed her chicken and ducks to be healthy and fat to earn more income to feed her family, to have some savings for the future, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and poultry feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman and she has one young child. Mgeni has run her own greengrocery business for the past 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Mgeni’s greatest challenge is keeping her perishable products fresh for long enough to sell. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mgeni will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cabbages, onions and other stock for her grocery. Mgeni aspires to become a local supplier for vegetable products in the future. She joined Yehu because its requirements are fair.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, onions and other stock for her grocery.

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb is 40 years old with 4 children. He is a farmer and he also fishes for additional income. He has been a farmer for 10 years. This is his third loan with VisionFund. He requested a loan to buy fertilizer for his farmland and do fishing. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yield with good quality to earn more income for his family in order to feed his family and have some savings for the future and his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland and do fishing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины. Он хочет продать свою машину и купить новую.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He's twenty-five years old, married and has worked as a taxi driver for the last eight years. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase a new car. He wishes to sell his old car and buy a new one.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Khabukwi

texts.en:
Khabukwi is a married woman with 5 children – 3 boys and 2 girls. Khabukwi operates a clothing resale business and sells her goods door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents.

She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality. Sales are lowest in January when most customers are focus on paying school fees. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees, rent, and food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Khabukwi will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase new stock for the holiday season, mainly women's dresses and children’s wear. Khabukwi aspires to import clothes and distribute to retailers in the future. She joined Yehu because its requirements are fair and the organization is very customer focused.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for the holiday season, mainly women's dresses and children’s wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of shoes for both women and men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saifurakhon

texts.ru: Сайфурахон имеет двоих детей. Она замужем. Муж работает разнорабочим. У него работа не постоянная и вот почему Сайфурахон начила свой собственный бизнес. Она любит свою семью и помогает мужу. Ведь они единое целое и все работают на благо семьи для улучшения своих бытовых условий. Она на рынке занимается выпечкой пирожков. Сфера общественного питания приносит немалые доходы. Она хочет получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони и приобрести себе оборудование для выпечки пирожков.
texts.en: Saifurakhon has two children.  She is married.  Her husband works as a handyman and does not have a permanent job.  This is why Saifurakhon decided to start her own business.  She loves her family and helps her husband because after all, they are a one whole and work for the well-being of the family in order to improve their living conditions.  Saifurakhon is involved in making piroshki (pies) at the market.  The public food field brings in good earnings.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni and buy equipment for making piroshki.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making piroshki

loans.name: Abdurofe

texts.ru: Абдурофеъ 18 лет занимается бизнесом. Он женат и имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Он на рынке занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Его жена домохозяйка. Он закупает оптом сухофрукты летом, в сезон занимается сушкой фруктов, а зимой перепродает их. От полученных доходов построил дом. Хочет получить $3000 США для оптового закупа сухофруктов. Он надеется на получение займа и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Abdurofe has been involved in business for 18 years.  He is married and has three adolescent children.  He sells dried fruits at a market.  Abdurofe's wife is a homemaker.  He buys dried fruits wholesale in the summer, dries fruits during the season and then resells them in the winter.  He used his business profits to build a house.  Abdurofe wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the wholesale purchase of dried fruits.  He hopes to get this loan and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Pulodoy

texts.ru: Пулодой жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок, сын. Ее сын на сегодняшний день находится в России. Сама Пулодой семь лет как открыла аптеку. Она имеет медицинское образование. Кредит берет для приобретения медикаментов. После смерти мужа она на работу не выходила. За этот период времени ее аптека опустела. Сейчас Пулодой намерена расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Pulodoy lives in the city of Istaravshan. She's forty-six years old, widowed and a one son. Her son is currently away on employment in Russia. 
Pulodoy has a degree in medicine and opened a pharmacy seven years ago. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase medical supplies. After the death of her husband, Pulodoy took a break from work, and her pharmacy is now empty. Now she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nematillo

texts.ru: Нематилло женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он умный и добросовестный человек. Для содержания семьи и улучшения домашних условий, он начинал свой бизнес 10 лет назад. Нематилло занимается купле-продажей продуктов питания  в своем магазине, который находится возле его дома. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его любящая жена. Они вместе усердно работают. За товарами ездит сам Нематилло 3-4 раза в месяц в соседний город. Его сын после возвращения из армии тоже помогают в бизнесе. Нематилло запрашивает займ для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов с целью увлечения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Nematillo is married and is a loving father of four children. He is smart and conscientious person.  In order to support his family and improve home conditions, he started his own business ten years ago.  Nematillo is involved in buying and selling food products in his store, which is located near his house.  His beloved wife helps him with this business, and they work diligently together.  Nematillo travels to the nearby town to buy his products 3-4 times per month.  Now that his son returned from the army, he also helps with the business.  Nematillo is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new assortment of products in order to increase his revolving capital.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to increase revolving capital

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school, while the other is yet too young to attend. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They live in a rental house with electricity and piped water, and their greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti has operated a leso (kanga) and cosmetics business for the past four years; her clients are local area residents. Theft is her major business challenge. Having decided to join Yehu Microfinance for access to loans, Mwanasiti is requesting one for Kshs 20,000 to purchase more stocks of lesos and cosmetics for resale. She aspires to establish a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of lesos and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женат. Ему 51 год. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Он 10 лет как занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdugafor lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 51 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Abdugafor has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years.  He breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.ru: Мухамад примерный семьянин имеет троих детей. Он занимается услугами такси на своей автомашине марки Газель. Его жена портниха. Они вместе стараются создать все условия для воспитания своих детей. Мухамад более пять лет занимается данным видом бизнеса. Он хочет получить займ в размере 7000 Cомони для достройки своего дома. Ведь всегда приятно, когда дома созданы все условия. Он надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Muhamad is an exemplary family man, who has three children.  He is involved in providing taxi services using his Gazel minivan.  His wife is a seamstress.  Together, they try to provide all of the necessary conditions for raising their children well.  Muhamad has been in this business for over five years.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to build his house.  After all, it is always pleasant when living conditions are well set up at home.  He hopes to have this loan approved.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces the major challenge of lack of stock during the rainy season. She dreams of expanding her business to selling firewood as well.

Fatuma is a married woman with two children who are still too young for school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Fatuma lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase 15 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо энергичная женщина. Она не может сидеть без работы и всегда старается чему-то обучаться. Она замужем имеет пятерых детей двух невесток и внуков. Семья большая, муж пенсионер. 44 года она занимается шитьем женских платьев, а начинала она с вышивки. Сейчас имеет вышивальную и швейную машинку. Занимается не только пошивом женских платьев, но шьет гардины на заказ. Она хочет получить займ в размере 10000 Cомони для покупки материалов для пошива гардин. В настоящее время это очень прибыльно, так как все шьют модные гардины для своих домов. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Marhabo is an energetic woman.  She cannot sit still without work and always tries to learn something new.  She is married and has five children, two daughters-in-law and grandchildren.  Their family is large, and her husband is retired.  Marhabo has been involved in sewing women's dresses for 44 years and started her business with embroidery.  Now she has an embroidery and sewing machines.  She is not only involved in sewing women's dress, but also sews drapes to-order.  Marhabo wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10 000 Somoni in order to buy materials for sewing drapes.  At the current time, this is a profitable activity because everyone orders stylish drapes for their homes.  She hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing drapes

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two school-going children.  Her husband is a seaman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanamisi has operated a food stall for the past 4 years; in addition she also sells coconuts. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; in some months of the year, like the month of Ramadan, demand is low. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bags of beans, wheat flour and 5 sacks of coconuts for her businesses. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans, wheat flour and 5 sacks of coconuts for her businesses.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru: Абдувахоб проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. У него среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков.
texts.en: Abduvahob lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 46 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary education.  Abduvahob earns a living by breeding cattle and primarily breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a single lady who owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Zainabu has operated a leso (kanga, or traditional African cloth) selling business for the past one year; her potential clients are the ladies of her community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 10 pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pairs of lesos (traditional African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Kodirali

texts.ru: Кодирали женат и любящий отец двух детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. На протяжении пяти лет он занимается откормом скота. Скотоводство приносить ему стабильный доход и поэтому он продолжает этот бизнес и хочет, чтоб его бизнес расширился. У Кодирали есть одно огромное желание и это увидеть своих детей в будущем образованными человеками и с этой целью он работает усердно день за днем. Кодирали хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки скота. Он очень надеется на вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Kodirali is married and is a loving father of two children.  He is a smart and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in fattening up livestock for five years.  Animal husbandry brings in a stable income, and this is why Kodirali continues this business and wants to expand it.  He has another great wish, and it is to see his children as educated people in the future, and with this goal in mind, he works very hard day after day.  Kodirali wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni for the purchase of livestock.  He hopes very much to get your support and help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man with 2 children aged twelve and ten. He runs a business making iron boxes and charcoal banners. The business is situated in a busy, highway market. He attracts passersby and residents. Despite the poor economy he desires to work hard and provide for his family and educate his children. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy scrap metal to make more items to sell. He described himself as goal oriented.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal

loans.name: Meiponyi

texts.en:
Meiponyi is 29 years. He is married with two children. He is a farmer with his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from the registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan which he is planning to use to prepare his land for maize and wheat planting. The two crops has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standard and education of his children and for business expansion. His dream is to prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize and wheat planting

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, a 34-year-old mother of one son and two daughters, is married to a carpenter who wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing a new carpentry kit. Linda is therefore requesting a loan of $1,500 from FATEN for this purpose. The kit will enable her husband to more effectively compete with others and secure extra work to increase his income and better provide for his family.

Linda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new carpentry kit to improve her husband's work.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a Kenyan and married with two children aged two and ten. His wife operates a grocery shop and he runs a metal shop in which he makes cookers, iron boxes and other items. The business is located in a busy market downtown and the customers he gets are those around the area. The challenge he faces is the high cost of purchasing the scrap metal. He is using his loan of kes 30,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business and get more income to take care of his family. His future dream is to become a leading supplier of the items he sells. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of insecurity; theft of her products. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Fatuma wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Mungoma

texts.en:
Mungoma is 39 years old, married and a father of two children. He has repaired bicycles for the last 7 years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy spare parts, spanners, tubes and grease.

He will save the anticipated profits and provide for the basic needs of his family. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a garage.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, spanners, tubes, and grease.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man who is living in his parents’ house. Since Mohammad has a good knowledge of computers and technology, he opened almost two years ago a small shop that has two sections: one is a café where he provides soft and hot drinks and sheesha (tobacco smoked in a pipe), and the other is an internet café.

Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to buy more assets for the shop and redecorate. In the future, he is planning to open each section of his shop in a separate place.

loans.use: to buy more assets for the shop and re-new its decoration

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a divorced woman with four children who are adults. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Esha has operated a food stall for the past 4years.  Her potential clients are school students. She faces a major challenge of low sales when schools are closed. She dreams of opening a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Esha wants to purchase beans and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its flexible repayment schedule.

loans.use: To purchase beans and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Mardina

texts.en: Mardina is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife takes care of the children at home. He was an employee in major car maintenance workshop until 2010, when he opened his own workshop. He is very skilled and specializes in car exteriors. Even though he is fairly new to the business, since he was a repairman for a long time, he is well known for his fast, convenient, and excellent work. He is a sharp and diligent man who says: "It is very difficult to run a business when you buy raw materials at retail price". He is requesting 1,600,000 MNT to buy mass amounts of spare parts.

loans.use: To buy mass amounts of spare parts.

loans.name: Mwangaluka Group

texts.en:
Aleleki, who is in her early 30s is married with four children. Three of them go to school, the fourth one is still a baby.  Alekeki has been running a  fruit and vegetable business for 6 months.  She works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables.  Her dream is to one day be able to have a retail/wholesale shop.

Aleleki will share this loan with her loan Group "Mwangaluka" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is single Kenyan woman aged 26 years old. She comes from the area of Ongata Rongai. She runs a small pharmacy in the market which is highly populated. She has been running this business for four years. She says the business is very profitable and the only major challenge she has is insecurity. She works hard from early morning to late evening to keep the business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy medicine to boost her business. She aspires to own a big pharmacy in the future. Elizabeth is described as honest.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service his motorcycle and repair worn-out parts.

loans.name: Mize

texts.en:
Mize is a divorced woman with 4 children who are all working. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Mize has operated a coconut selling business for the past 13 years. In addition she also sells fruit. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; where there is low demand in some months of the year. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 3 sacks of coconuts and some fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of their customer care.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of coconuts and some fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kalikwa

texts.en:
Kalikwa is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Kalikwa has operated a cosmetics shop for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts in time. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 Kalikwa wants to purchase body creams, hair relaxer and hair extensions for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase body creams, hair relaxer and hair extensions for her shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.

Amina has operated a leso (kanga, or traditional African cloth) selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 10 pairs of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pairs of lesos (traditional African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Since 2007, Ahmad has been an owner of a motorcycle shop, selling and repairing motorcycles. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where a lot of customers pass by.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan in order to renovate his shop. His aim is to gain more profits, which will give him the opportunity of providing a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate his shop.

loans.name: Maasooma

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and a mother for three children.

Maasooma has been a tailor since 2009. She makes, repairs or alters clothing professionally as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than four years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she has become well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for $1200 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: In order to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Nkuyata

texts.en:
Nkuyata has been farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 32 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of one child. 

Ahlam has been a professional tailor since 2008, making, repairing, or altering clothing such as suits, coats, and trousers for women. She has more than four years' experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in the surrounding area.

She decided to apply for a loan of $1800 to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. She is aiming to earn more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Miri

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married, and the father of four children, one of whom works.

Miri has owned a food market since 2001. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs as well as sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2100 in order to repair and fix his market’s walls and floors and to make new showcases. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to repair his market and make new showcases.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with 16 children, six of whom are enrolled in school while the rest are all adults. His wife is businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Rama has operated a fish and seafood selling business for the past 10 years; in addition, he owns a motorbike transportation business. His potential clients are mostly hotel and café owners. He faces a major challenge of seasonality when there are no fish in the sea in the cold season. He dreams to expand his business.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more fish and seafood for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance in order to acquire capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Kenyan man aged 26 years old. He operates a barber shop in an area known as Maasai Lodge in the region of Ongata Rongai. The area is densely populated and his customers are mostly the local residents in the area. He has been running this business for five years and has hired two employees. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has are high costs of operation, especially electricity bills. He will use his loan of KES 50,000 to buy electric shavers. Besides the barber shop, Paul also farms. In the future, he wishes to have a modern barber shop that is fully stocked with proper equipment. He is described as very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy electric shavers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and a father of three children.

A. is a tailor; in 2003 he opened his own workshop for sewing and embroidery. He also makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats, and trousers for men and women. He has more than four years' experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local customers and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase an embroidery machine. He is aiming to gain more profit to improve his family’s lives.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 39-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary, and to increase his income he works on electric networks. He wants to have new electrician kit and tools that help in improving his work. 

Sara wants to help her husband in getting this kit and tools, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Sara gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a new electrician kit and tools for her husband; this will enable her husband to improve the quality of his work and serve more customers, which will increase his income and offer to the family better living conditions. 

Sara is a conservative woman, so her husband Adli is photographed while he is working.

loans.use: To purchase a new electrician kit and tools to use in improving the quality of his work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with seven children, five of who are enrolled in school while the rest have finished school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. He owns a house with has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Ali has operated a fish and seafood selling business for the past ten years. His potential clients are mostly hotel owners. He faces a major challenge of lack of sufficient capital to run the business efficiently. He aspires to increase sales in his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase more fish and seafood for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of three children. Hussein has owned an electrical equipment and materials shop since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding area. 

Hussein is requesting a loan of $2400 to renovate and repair the wall in his shop and to add to his inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Eliakim

texts.en: Eliakim is Kenyan man and married with two children aged 8 and 4 years old. His spouse is a housewife. He runs a welding business at a busy market in Rongai. He makes and sells steel doors, windows and other items to the local people. His customers vary from middle to high class and are mostly people who are building houses. The challenges he confronts are a lack of enough space for running his business. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more steel to grow his business. In future, he hopes to own a big welding shop with enough space to carry business. He describes himself as honest and determined.

loans.use: To buy more steel.

loans.name: Mwanazia

texts.en:
Mwanazia has operated as a religion teacher for the past four years. Her potential clients are the children of her village. She faces the major challenge of lack of students at her school. She is a divorced woman with one child who is enrolled in school. She lives in her family’s house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Mwanazia wants to purchase stationary for her school. She dreams of expanding her business and adding two more classrooms. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get capital to enhance her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stationary for her school.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 34 years old. She is a single mother of two children aged 18 and 17 years old. She operates a retail kiosk and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her third term loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase a solar panel to enhance lighting in her house. Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua has operated a café for the past three years. Her potential clients are people at the marketplace. She faces a major challenge of competition from other café operators. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase beans, rice, tea leaves, sugar and coconut oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of access to loan facilities. She dreams of expanding her business.

Nadzua is a married woman with two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, tea leaves, sugar and coconut oil for her café.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts, lubricants, tires, etc.

loans.name: Grace Wanja

texts.en: Grace is married Kenyan lady. She is married to a businessman and they have a 3-year-old son whom they hope to give good education to the university level.
