She runs a salon located at a strategic location known as Maasai Lodge area in Ongata Rongai. She has been in this business for 5 years and has hired two employees. The business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high cost of electricity. She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to buy salon equipment to grow her business. Her goal is to have the best salon at the Masaai lodge area in the future. Grace is patient and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Allaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Allaoui is carpenter. Since 2006, he has owned a workshop where he makes and sells furniture. He has more than ten years' experience in this field, a good reputation, and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well known in the surrounding area. 

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to purchase woodworking machinery. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase woodworking machinery.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 52 years old woman, she is married and has one son and four daughters, she is an employee in The Ministry of Social Affairs with decent salary, her husband is a doctor and has a medical clinic and he wants to improve his work by purchasing more new Medical equipment. Sabha wants to help her husband in getting more Medical equipment, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Sabha gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband in purchasing more new Medical equipment, so her husband will be able to improve his work and compete well with other similar medical clinics, his customers will increase and he will work extra to increase his income and provide better living conditions to the family. Sabha is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his medical clinic.

loans.use: To purchase more Medical equipment.

loans.name: Tseyenhorloo

texts.en: Tseyenhorloo is 67 years old and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son works in a mining company. She was a cook in a power plant for 20 years and when she retired, recently, she opened her own cafe in a rented workspace. She enjoys her job and her dishes are known as the tastiest and cheapest. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says: "It makes me happy when people enjoy my food". She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy food supplies for her fresh start.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with three children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her children.

Mwanakombo has operated a vegetable stall for the past three years; she sells from home and her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales during the dry spell due to poor harvests. She aspires to expand her business and open a grocery in the market area.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, carrots and cabbages for her business.

loans.name: Fiza's Group

texts.en:
Fiza is 55 years old. She spends her time doing her household responsibilities and operating her paper envelope making business. She collects orders from different grocery stores and stationary shops and fulfills them to earn an income. 
Her husband is involved in a business selling toys. Fiza has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s toy business. With the loan, he will buy different kinds of toys to sell, such as plastic and battery-operated toys. 
He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Fiza is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband by expanding his business. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fiza.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children.

Ali is a professional tailor. Since 2000, he has owned a workshop where he makes, repairs, and alters clothing such as as suits, coats, and trousers for women and men. He has more than four years' experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He has decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Tuzamurane/mrnd Group

texts.fr:
Alphonse fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane/Mrnd. Le nom du groupe signifie «s’entraider l’un pour l’autre ». Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 6 à 21 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Alphonse est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Alphonse voudrait être fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alphonse is a member of Tuzamurane/Mrnd Group, whose name means "to help each other". He's 52 years old, and married with six children, age 6 to 21. They all attend school. His own level of education amounts six years of elementary school.

Alphonse is a rice cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to select the seeds he sows. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be a rice provider in his region. With his profits, he intends to educate and provide healthcare to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman with seven children six of whom are enrolled in school and the other one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for family.

Saum has operated as a cashew nuts seller for the past one year; she sells her products from the market place and her potential clients are the people who come to the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where the cashew nuts are available only during the harvesting season. She aspires to become a cashew nuts supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase ten bags of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access fund to help her boost her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Soltanmurat

texts.en:
Soltanmurat is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is an unemployed woman who stays at home, and his three kids are all college and high school students. He started his transportation business in 1997 with his own van. At first, he was transporting people only within the province. Now he takes people to Russia, and also buys groceries from Russia and sells them. 

Soltanmurat is requesting 2,600,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair his van. With winter approaching, he needs to perform these repairs and save some supplies. He is a strong and diligent man who says "I will do everything I can in order to educate my kids".

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his van

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36-years-old, married and has one child. 

Haydar has been the owner of a women's clothing shop since 2010. He sells cosmetics, accessories and clothing. He has more than five years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1200 loan in order to build an outdoor ceiling, produce ad boards and to purchase more mannequins for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, produce ad boards and to purchase more mannequins for his shop.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Group

texts.fr:
Eliab fait partie du groupe Duteraninkunga. Le nom du groupe signifie «renforçons nous tout ensemble  ». Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 6 mois à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 1 an de secondaire.

Eliab est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionnée du riz et d’utilisation des engrais. Dans les prochaines années, Eliab voudrait être un grand fournisseur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Eliab is a member of Duteraninkunga Group, whose name means "let's be stronger together". He's 43 years old, and is married with six children, aged 6 months to 12 years. Two of them attend school. He himself attended middle school for one year.

Eliab is a rice cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected rice seeds and fertilizers. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be a large provider in his region. With his profits, he intends to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Selman

texts.en: Selman is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one school aged child. He works really hard in cooperation with his wife to be able to satisfy the family needs. His wife has been working as a teacher for the past four years; while he has been working in the construction field since 2003. He is specialized at completing woodwork projects. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his business and increase his productivity by purchasing added construction materials and tools. In the future, he plans to have his own concrete industry.

loans.use: to expand his business and increase his productivity by purchasing added construction materials and tools

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31-years-old, married and has two children. 

Haydar has been the owner of a wholesale food market since 2000. He sells flour and all kinds of grain. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to make showcases, an outdoor ceiling, ad boards and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: to make showcases, build an outdoor ceiling, ad boards and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanasiti has operated a retail shop for the past one year; she runs her business from home and her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods to her place of business. She aspires to expand her business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Umitker

texts.en: Umitker is 47 years old and lives with his wife and seven kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife stays at home and babysits her children: two elder ones are college students and are 20 and 17 years old; three middle ones are school students and are 12, 10 and 14 years old; and two younger one go to kindergarten and are 4 and 2 years old. He started his business as a handyman in 1990. Now he makes roofs, fences, doors and windows. His average monthly income is 1,600,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Recently, he received mass amount of orders for doors and windows. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I will do everything I can in order to educate my kids." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more wood materials for doors and windows.

loans.use: To buy more wood materials.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.He is 32-years-old, married and has two children.

Saddam has been the owner of a food market since 2000. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items.He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to repair and fix his market’s floor and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair and fix his market’s floor and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a single 27-year-old man. He runs a general store where he sells food items, detergents, and beverages. His business is located at the busy Masaai Lodge area in Ongata Rongai. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. He has been in the business for three years now. He is using his loan of KES 50,000 to buy more stocks of food items like sugar, flour, and cooking oil. His future dream is to own a supermarket. He describes himself as honest and patient.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food items like sugar, flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school while the rest have finished school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the basic needs of the family. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Riziki has operated a retail shop for the past three years; she sells her products from home and her potential clients are her neighbors. Her major challenge is a lack of enough stock to sell. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en: Yanjinlham is 68 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a retired old man who stays at home and her kids live independently. She started her grocery retailing business in 2002 by renting a counter in the market. Now she sells grocery and diary products. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to save her winter supply. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have done everything for my children. Now that they are living independently, it is time to expand my business". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Arsenal Group

texts.en:
Safina, who is in her early 50s is married with four children and seven grand children. She has been selling fish and charcoal for one year now.  She works from 5 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzani.  She used the previous loans to increase on the fish stock and also started selling charcoal as well. She has paid back all her loans succesfully. She wants a loan to buy more stock of fish and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to make her business big.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Arsenal" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55-years-old, married and has four children.

Salha has been the owner of a food market since 2000. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a  $1800 loan in order to build an outdoor ceiling, sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, sliding door and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school aged children. He’s the only income provider of his family. He has been working as a taxi driver for the past seven years and this is his only main income source. He took advantage from two Kiva loans and we note that he has a very good repayment history. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van including changing its wheels. This will help him proceed with his business operation targeting larger clientele . In the future, he plans to collect enough money and buy a bigger van.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van including changing its wheels

loans.name: Muthana

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Muthana is the owner of a food market. Since 2007, he has been selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent and add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay annual rent and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 24 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She has been selling used clothes for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of KES 65,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.  She will save the anticipated profits from this loan and pay her children’s school fees. In the future she hopes to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tungishbai

texts.en: Tungishbai is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife and eldest son help with his business. His younger two children are in school and kindergarten. He started his butcher shop in 2007 by renting a counter in a market. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to buy livestock before prices get high. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I need to go to rural areas and buy some livestock before prices get high." He is requesting 1,650,000 MNT to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36-years-old, married and has four children.

Ghassan has been the owner of a food market since 2009. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sandaglham

texts.en:
Sandaglham is a widowed woman who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two kids are college students. She started her retail business by opening a grocery shop in 1996. 

In recent years, many buildings have been built and her shop's income is increasing rapidly. Due to a lack of supplies, though, growth has been slow. 

Her daily income is 350,000 MNT and it has potential to increase. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says " I have a two college kids and it is hard to pay two fees but I will not rest until my two kids are educated". 

She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Oday

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30-years-old, married and a father of one child.

Oday has been the owner of a blacksmithing shop since 2004; making metal doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2000 in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Erkhembaatar

texts.en:
Erkhembaatar is 33 years old, has a son and daughter ages 4 to 10, lives in outer ger district, a district without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter and son attend kindergarten and secondary school while their mother works as a Chemistry teacher at her son’s school. 

Erkhembaatar has worked as a musical technician at local stadium in 1999-2006. After that, he started to operate own musical instrument renting business. Now he has 15 million MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ priced musical instruments and tools. His business advantage is in Mongolia, there are few entrepreneurs who operates this kind of business. Therefore Erkhembaatar’s business is very popular and he often participates in concert and rents his instruments. 

As his business growing, he became owns a lot of instruments, so he doesn’t have any depository for instruments to keep these. So he decided to built own new depository for instruments and tools. He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials for his new depository for instruments. If he finish it, he will operate business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials for his new depository for instruments

loans.name: Nsuari

texts.en:
Nsuari has operated a weaved items (mats and coconut roof thatches) selling business for the past ten years; she sells her products from home and her potential clients are her neighbors and the village residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where sometimes there is low demand especially during the dry seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more coconut dry leaves and sisal for weaving her products. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire financial assistance to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut dry leaves and sisal for weaving her products.

loans.name: Dabiétou

texts.fr:
Dabiétou est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée à un technicien  et est mère de 2 enfants  dont 1 scolarisé.  L’aîné a 5 ans et le  dernier 1 an.
Dabiétou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle achète et vend des produits d’alimentation générale genre les sucres, laits, savons, détergents … et des produits de beauté à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Lomé, et travaille seule.
Dabiétou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générales destinés à la vente. Elle pense épargner ses économies pour développer son activité.
Dans  les prochaines années, Dabiétou voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de ventes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Dabiétou is 28, married to a technician, and the mother of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school. The older child is five and the younger, one year old. 

Dabiétou has been working at small-scale retailing since 2010. She has been buying and selling grocery products such as sugar, milk, soap, detergent, etc., and cosmetic products in her shop to all comers.  She stocks up on merchandise from wholesalers in Lomé and works alone. 

Dabiétou has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy grocery products for resale. She intends to put aside savings to develop her business. 

In the coming years, Dabiétou would like to open up other sales points. She says that with the profit, she intends to contribute to covering the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. At the first, he started to work as a farmer for the past 30 years specialized in cultivating olives. Then, he decided to work as an employee in a water company in 2000. Some of his children are still attending school; and this is the reason why he was obliged to have two jobs in order to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a mini van to help him with his product distribution. In the future, he plans to diversify his business operation and start cultivating different types of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase a mini van to help him with his product distribution

loans.name: Anthony Joseph

texts.en:
Antony is a 41 year old married man.  He is married to a business woman and they have 5 children whose ages range between twenty seven and eighteen years old. 

He runs a pharmacy and sells medicine to the local people. His business is located at the busy Maasai lodge area in Rongai. He has been in this business for five years and employs one person. He requires a loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more medicine to boost his stock. His future dream is to run a clinical pharmacy which is fully stocked with a variety of medicine. He describes himself as very honest and straight forward.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and increase her inventory

loans.name: Barir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.

Barir has been the owner of a painting and calligraphy shop since 1990. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a billboard printing machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a billboard printing machine.

loans.name: Erlan

texts.en:
Erlan is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four kids in a ger(Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her youngest kids and two elder kids are school students. 

He started his taxi business in 2005 with his own sedan. He has done some research and found that providing transportation by pick-up truck is much more profitable. He has found a buyer for his old sedan and a reasonable seller of a pick-up truck. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a new pick-up truck.

loans.use: To buy a new pick-up truck

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother with one school going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Lucy has operated a vegetable selling business for the past six months; she sells her products at the market and her potential clients are the people at the market area. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales in the dry season because of poor harvests. She aspires to expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more vegetables like onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables like onions for her business.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is 47 years old  and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her 3 year old daughter. 

He started his taxi service in 2008 with his own car. He has many regular customers and he is known for his excellent service. His daily income is 25,000-35,000 MNT.  Now that winter is approaching, he needs to change the tires and replace a few parts in preparation for the harsh winter. He is requesting 800,000 to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Rubens

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Xai-Xai, Provincia de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos  todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 sobrinhos enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas. 

É segurança numa casa privada ha mais de 3 anos e também pensionista na empresa CFM (caminhos de ferro de Moçambique) recebe mensalmente 5.000.00mt juntados os 2 rendimentos que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros). Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt aplicados na obra da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende comprar motobombas, para  aumentar a produtividade na sua machamba, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rubens was born in the city of Xai-Xai, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children who are still in school. He attended school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports three nephews, sending money to help with their expenses. 

He has been a security guard at a private house for more than three years, and is also retired from CFM (Mozambique Railways). He earns a total of 5,000 meticals a month, which he uses to pay for household expenses and save some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 17,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to continue construction on his house. His previous loans, in the amounts of 12,000 and 18,000 meticals, were also used for his home.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to buy electric pumps to increase productivity on his farm, for which he will request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete finishing his house to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат замужем имеет четверых детей. Взрослые дети помогают по бизнесу. У них свой магазин. Семья большая и содержать ее очень трудно. Для этого приходится много трудиться. В магазине они продают товары народного потребления продовольственные и промышленные товары. Магазин очень удобен для клиента, так как у нее они могут найти все. Фарогат хочет пополнить ассортименты своего товара детской одежды, также продукты питания. Она надеется на ваше одобрение и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Farogat is married and has four children. Her adult children help her with the business. They have own grocery store. Their family is large and it's hard to support it and they need to work a lot for this. In their store they sell consumer goods, food and industrial products. The store is very convenient for the customers because they can find everything there. Farogat wants to fulfill the variety of children's clothing and also food products. She hopes for your approval and is thanking you in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products and children's clothing.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos e todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa. 

É motorista numa empres  de transporte de mercadoria divesa ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 5.250.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (pranchas, cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children who are still in school. He attended school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own and also supports his mother-in-law, sending her money to help her with her expenses.

He has been a driver for a transport company for more than two years and earns 5,250 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (boards, cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (boards, cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.

loans.name: Nsene

texts.en:
Nsene is a married woman with three school going children. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Nsene has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years; she sells her products at the market and her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where people buy clothes mostly during the festive season. She dreams of expanding her business into a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers good financial services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cremildo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Frequenta o ensino medio, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Gaza para Boane na companhia dos pais ainda pequeno, é tecnico de informatica ha mais de 3 anos, e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um escritorio de consultoria de contabilidade e serviços, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cremildo was born in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is unmarried and has no children. He is going to middle scool. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

He and his parents left Gaza for Boane when he was still young. He has been a computer technician for more than three years and earns a salary of 8,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings to pay for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to start a business offering accounting and other services, for which he will request further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 11 anos dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e tem um  rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM) e conta com ajuda do seu marido mas despesas de casa.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para aumentar a sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir mais casas para aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children, three of whom are still in school. She went to school through the sixth grade, but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

She's had a shop where she sells a variety of products for more than 11 years and she earns about 15,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM). Her husband also helps with expenses.
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to expand her house.
She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to build more houses to rent out.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to expand her house.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a single, 32-year-old lady with two children, who are four and ten years old. She runs a small shop that specializes in selling ladies handbags. The business is located at Rongai and her primary customers are women. She has been doing this business for two years now, and she says that the business is profitable. The major challenges she faces are those of weather changes. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of handbags. She hopes to own a well stocked boutique in Rongai in the future. Damaris describes herself as honest.

loans.use: To add to her stock of handbags

loans.name: Delgerbayar

texts.en:
Delgerbayar is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk in a shop. Delgerbayar operates a taxi service business. He started his taxi service business in 2009, using his own car. His business is going so well that he payed his car loan two years before the time it was due. 

Now that his business is going well, he plans to open a clothes trading business and to rent a counter in a market. Since his wife is a clerk, the business should be easy to run, and he is planning to renew his car. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy supplies for his car and to purchase clothes for his new business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his car and to purchase clothes for his new business.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos dos quais um bebé e o outro frequenta a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e frequentou a formação de professores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ela. 

É professora na Escola Primaria Fishe ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 7.395.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (BIM) no valor de 20.000.00mt e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldades. Conheceu  a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (blocos, cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has two children - one of them is a baby and the other one attends school. She completed 12th grade and studied to become a teacher. She lives with her family in a house she owns and she also supports a nephew who lives with her.
She has been a teacher at Fishe Primary School for over six years and earns a salary of 7.395mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan in another bank before and finished repaying it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution.
This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies for her house (cinder blocks, cement, stone, sand, rafters, etc.). She promises to repay according to the schedule. 
n the future, she intends to finish building and furnishing her house, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans to Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house (cinder blocks, cement, stone, sand, rafters, etc.).

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with seven children, six of whom are enrolled in school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanarusi has operated a poultry selling business for the past five years; she operates her business from home and her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to invest in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to get funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 21-year-old Lebanese engaged woman living with one parent and three siblings. She has been working as a nurse since 2008 healing patients wherever they are located. In parallel, she started to work in a local hospital in 2009. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on her car which will facilitate her transportation towards patients. In the future, she plans to take another Kiva loan in order to strengthen her business and earn more income as she intends to get married soon and needs to support her fiancé with the wedding expenses.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on her car which will facilitate her transportation towards patients

loans.name: Manat

texts.en: Manat is widowed and a loving mother of three. Her elder two kids are college students and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. She started her garment retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in the local market. Now that winter is approaching she needs to buy more warmer clothes to resell. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says, "It has been hard since my husband died. I try everything to support them and I will not rest until my kids get educated and independent." She is requesting MNT 1,000,000 to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Victor

texts.fr:
Victor est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié à une restauratrice, et eurent ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés. Le premier a 6 ans et le dernier 9 mois. 
Victor travaille comme meunier et conducteur de taxi moto depuis 2008. Il moud des céréales  à ces clients et en temps mort, il remorque toutes personnes nécessitant un service de moto au marché d’Agoè à Lomé.
Victor a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un moulin ; et  pense réinvestir le surplus de ses profits dans le développement de son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Victor voudrait voire ses activités prospérer. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit  assurer un épanouissement total à sa famille.
texts.en:
Victor is 33 and married to a cooked food seller. They have three children, of whom two are enrolled in school. The oldest is six and the youngest, nine months old. 
 
Victor has been working as a miller and a motorcycle taxi driver since 2008. He grinds grains for his clients, and when he has down-time, he carries whoever needs motorcycle services to the market in Agoè in Lomé.

Victor has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy a mill. He intends to reinvest any surplus profit into the development of his activity. 

In the coming years, Victor would like to see his businesses prosper. He says that with the profit, he intends to make sure his whole family blossoms.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos e todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.


É comerciante ha mais de 5 anos vende produtos diversos , e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Ja teve emprestimo noutros bancos (TCHUMA) e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos diversos ( sumos, arroz, oleo, peixe, batatas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende comprar um carro para reforçar no escoamento do produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 10th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been in retail for over five years. She sells various kinds of goods and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had loans in other banks and finished repaying without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase various goods (juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
She is committed to repaying according to the schedule. In the future she intends to purchase a car to bolster the sales of her merchandise. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.).

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de uma filha ja casada. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ele.


Saiu da Matola para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. É comerciante ha mais de 29 anos , e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos diversos (farinha, sumos, arroz, oleo, peixe, batatas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende adiquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no escoamento do produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He is married and has a daughter who is already married. He completed 9th grade and didn't continue because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his parents who live with him.
He left Matola for Boane in search of better living conditions. He has been in retail for over 29 years and earns an income of about 6.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase various goods (flour, juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.) in order to increase the amount of his merchandise.
He promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future he intends to purchase a vehicle to help him sell his merchandise. For that purpose he plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (flour, juice, rice, oil, fish, potatoes, etc.).

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 30-year-old housewife and a mother of six sons and daughters. She is married to Hani, a 37-year-old man who provides and helps the wedding planners with the equipment needed for the party by renting tents, seats, DJ equipment and other items.

Wafaa wants to help her husband by applying for this loan so he can fix a few pieces of broken equipment and buy new model tents to keep up with the modern type events. 

Because Wafaa is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to fix broken equipment and buy new tents

loans.name: Lamech

texts.en:
Lamech is a 28 year old man. He is married and they have two children who are aged 1 year and 3 years old. They hope to give a good education to their children up to the university level. He runs a pharmacy which is located at the busy Maasai lodge area in Rongai. 

He has been running this business for three years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He hopes to grow his business and make income to sustain his family. 

He describes himself as honest and responsible.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Mmwanarusi

texts.en:
Mmwanarusi is a married woman with 5 children 3 of whom are enrolled in school while the rest are too young for school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for children.

Mmwanarusi has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; cashew nuts are harvested in seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Kulziya

texts.en:
Kulzya is a widowed woman who lives with her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her eldest son is an entrepreneur and the younger two are college students. 

She started her craft business in 2000 by making small accessories like purses, wallets, and small bags. 

In recent years, the tourists are increasing therefore her demand for her products is increasing. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says "I will not rest until my kids get educated". She is requesting 800,000 to buy more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: And Jef Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe And Jeff  est composé de 9 membres depuis la création du Banc Villageois suite au bon voisinage et une bonne cohabitation. 

Madame Nguénar debout a droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée âgé de 45 ans. Elle mariée et  mère de 12 enfants .

Elle mène une activité de commerce de détails avec son nouveau prêt de 50000 francs cfa elle compte acheter du lait du sucre du savon de la cigarette destiné a la revente. 

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son activité pour l'avoir mené pendant plusieurs années.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va payer les frais d inscription a une mutuelle de santé pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group called "And Jef" has been  made up of nine members since the creation of the "Banc Villageois" (community bank), based on being good neighbors and living well together.  

Madame Nguénar, who is standing on the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married, aged 45, and the mother of 12 children.  

She has a small-scale retail business and with her new loan of 50,000 F CFA she intends to buy milk, sugar, soap, and cigarettes for resale. 

She has a lot of experience in her business as she has been in it for several years. With her profit, she will pay the registration fees in a health insurance plan for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, soap, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children one of whom is enrolled in school while the other is too young for school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanajuma has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past 5 years; her potential clients are people at the market place. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; cashew nuts are harvested in seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mejumaa has operated a cashew nuts selling business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; cashew nuts are harvested in seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bags of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is 40 years of age, married and her husband is a milk seller. He sells milk and yogurt to his community clients on cheap rates. The quality of milk he sells is very good. Mussarat is very cooperative, and sews clothes for supporting her family.  She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education after intermediate and started work. He does a job in factory. 2nd one is an expert in computer embroidery and 3rd son works with his father at his milk selling shop while younger one reads in 8th standard. Her daughter reads in 12th standard. 

Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah fort the establishment of her husband’s milk selling business. With the loan, he will buy milk in larger quantity that will allow him to be able to sell more and earn better income. He has started operating his business 3 months ago and his business very much new. Mussarat is hopeful that after the loan investment he will be able to get established in it and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mussarat.

loans.use: To buy milk for selling

loans.name: Buviniso

texts.ru: Бувинисо занимается бизнесом на протяжении 11 лет. Она замужем любит свою семью. У нее трое несовершеннолетних детей. Доходы уходят на обучение и содержание семьи. Она старается во всем помогать мужу. В бизнесе  вместе с ней задействован старший сын. На рынке она продает детскую одежду. Наступают праздники и зима. Следует пополнить ассортимент товара и обновить его. Бувинисо хотела бы получить займ и увеличить свой товарооборот. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Buviniso has been in business for 11 years. She is married and loves her family. She has three minor children. Her income is spent supporting her family and paying for the children’s education. She tries to help her husband in all things. Her eldest son is helping her out in the business. She sells children’s clothing at a local market. Winter and the holiday season are coming. It is time to expand and renew her stock of goods. Buviniso would like to receive a loan to increase her sales volume. She hopes to obtain this loan and thanks you in advance for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en: The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of clothes to raise her business' working capital.

loans.use: To raise her business' working capital

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhjargal, aged 52, works as a janitor in a retirement home which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing this job for 6 years and during this time she has helped many elders. Enkhjargal is a widow and lives with her daughter in the slum district. Her house has become very old and uncomfortable, so it urgently needs some adjustments. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing some building materials that are needed to make adjustments to her house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials that are needed to make adjustments to her house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and blessed with 2 young children, both of which are currently enrolled in school. For the past 3 years, Mariam has run her own general store and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is oil. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Mariam will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy oil, sugar, cereals and soap for her store. Mariam aspires to open another shop in town in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, cereals and soap for her store.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 27 years old and the father of two daughters and one son.

Osama started a small business selling fruits and vegetables years ago. Because he didn’t have enough money to open a speciA. shop for that, he decided to use his bus as a base for his business. 

Now Osama has applied for a new loan to buy more fruits and vegetables that are requested by his customers so he can serve as many of the people living in the neighborhood as he can.

In the future, he is planning to open a grocery store in his area.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 27 years old. Last month, he and his wife Lena were blessed with their first child. Juma runs a retail kiosk and Lena also runs her own shop in town. He's worked in this business for one-and-a-half years and was previously employed doing masonry work.  In addition to his kiosk, he also has a side job in construction.

Juma's customers are primarily his neighbors and other local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Juma plans to use this 25,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and washing detergents for his Kiosk. He aspires to open a larger shop in the future so he will be better able to support his growing family. He joined Kiva field partner Yehu because of their favorable loan products.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and washing detergents for his Kiosk.

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en: Hadbaatar is taking a loan to purchase some bricks and other insulation materials to make adjustments to his house.

loans.use: To purchase some bricks and other insulation materials to make adjustments to his house.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a 43-year-old married woman. She and her husband Juma are blessed with eight children and four are currently enrolled in school. Nyevu crafts brooms and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for four years and her customers are primarily her neighbors and other local residents.

Nyevu's other sources of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.   Nyevu plans to use this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more raw materials for making brooms. Nyevu aspires to open her own shop and become a wholesale supplier in the future. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because they are strong advocates for low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for use in making brooms

loans.name: Shairbubu

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Shairbubu obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. Shairbubu is 54 years old and married. She has four children and is responsible for three children of her deceased brother-in-law. 

Shairbubu graduated from college and worked at the local kindergarten as a nurse. In order to find a means of subsistence for her large family, in 1995 she began to breed livestock. Her persistent and hard work allowed Shairbubu to maintain a farm with one cow, ten sheep, and two goats. With the revenue from this activity, she was able to pay for education for her daughters. 

Currently, Shairbubu is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase two bull calves, forage for her cattle and building materials for reconstructing her house’s roof.  Using the revenues from this loan, she plans further development of the business activities. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 42-year-old married woman. Her husband Rimbe works as a farmer and together they have eight children. All of her children are currently enrolled in school. She plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to open her own vegetable kiosk at the market. 

Joyce describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because they offer loan products that fit her needs.

loans.use: to open a egetable kiosk at the local market

loans.name: Zulfizar

texts.ru: Зулфизар трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и имеет два сына и одну девочку. Её муж занимается земледелием, тракторист. Его заработанные деньги не хватает на содержании семьи и чтобы помогать мужу Зулфизар начала заниматься скотоводством и более 4 года она продолжает свое дело. У нее большой опыт в по данному виду бизнеса. Она стремится улучшить условия домохозяйства и хочет устроить мероприятие по обрезанию. Зулфизар хочет получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Zulfizar is hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is married and has two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is involved in farming as a tractor operator.  His earnings are not enough to support the family, and, in order to help her husband, Zulfizar started to get involved in animal husbandry and has been running her business for over four years.  She has an extensive experience in this business.  Zulfizar tries to improve conditions of her household and wants to hold a circumcision ceremony.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ghiwa

texts.en:
Ghiwa is a 29-year-old Lebanese woman who is married and lives with her husband. She has been selling hand made products, such as wooden sculptures and leather bags, for the past four years. Her business is based at her home.

Ghiwa has had a Kiva-funded loan before, and was a very good client who repaid her loan promptly.  She plans to use this $1,000 from Kiva field partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory of new items to sell such as bags, statuettes, carvings etc… . In the future, she plans to open her own retail shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new items to sell such as bags, statuettes, carvings etc…

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with one young child who is currently enrolled in school. Eunice works as a tailor and sells her goods from home. She's been a tailor for four years and her customers are primarily her neighbors and other local residents. Eunice describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Eunice plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy fabric in preparation for the Christmas season. Eunice aspires to open a large store with several sewing machines in the future. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because of their favorable loan products and conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric in preparation for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a half a bale of pagnes and a half a bundle of hand bags.

loans.name: Maysour

texts.en: Maysour is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife and three children who are still attending school.  His wife, who has worked as a female hairdresser since 2005 receiving clients at her home, helps him with the household expenses. As for Maysour, he has been working as a taxi driver since 2002 transporting customers wherever they want. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his car's engine and increase its safety features. In the future, he plans to purchase another car and hire an employee to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to renew his car's engine and increase its safety features

loans.name: Hanatou

texts.fr:
Hanatou est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée.  
Hanatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend des épices à toutes personnes, dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana ou à Lagos(NIGERIA). Elle travaille seule. 
Hanatou a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des épices destinés à la vente. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires étendre son marché.    
Dans les prochaines années, Hanatou voudrait plus développer son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’assurer une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Hanatou is 41 and married. She has worked as a small-scale retailer since 1999. She sells spices to all comers in  Lomé. She buys her merchandise in Ghana or in Lagos (Nigeria). She works alone. 
 
Hanatou has requested her first loan from  WAGES to buy spices for resale. She wants to use the supplementary profit to expand her market. 

In the coming years,  Hanatou would like to develop her business further. She says that with the profit, she expects to be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en: Nadeem is a 24-year-old young man. He is a DJ player and has all the assistant instruments and tools that make his work successful. Nadeem wants to expand his work and open a photography and DJ shop, so he wants to prepare it well for the opening such as installing lights, installing furniture, installing seals, etc, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. So he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nadeem gets the loan, he will be able to pay the expenses to open the DJ and photography shop, and prepare well so he will increase his customers and increase his income. This will lead him to have better living conditions. Nadeem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To open a photography and DJ shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages four and seven, who are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a welder. Josephine operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for six years and was previously employed as a receptionist. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Josephine describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Josephine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sewing materials for her business. Josephine aspires to open a boutique and cosmetics shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady is a 39-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and six children. Some of his children are still attending school. Despite his situation, Fady represents the main income source of the family. He has been working in the construction field for the past 16 years and he is talented at finalizing woodwork tasks. Today, he’s looking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase wood for his work, which will make his business operation much easier to accomplish. In the future, he plans to expand his work and have his own business and employees.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 40-year-old married man. Together with his wife Florence, they are blessed with a three-year-old child. For the past 3½ years, Felix has operated his own vegetable kiosk and his primary customers are his neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Felix will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables. Felix aspires to open more kiosks and continue expanding his business in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Chehadeh

texts.en: Chehadeh is a 27-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has owned a mobile shop since 2007 where he sells different types of mobiles and related accessories. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his merchandise selection and purchase additional cell phones and prepaid cards to sell. He is a smart businessman and strives to work really hard. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business and add new technological devices.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection and purchase cell phones and prepaid cards to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 40-year-old married man. Together with his wife Florence, they are blessed with a three-year-old child. For the past 3½ years, George has operated his own vegetable kiosk and his primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

George will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables. George aspires to open more kiosks and continue expanding his business in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single lady who is 28 years old with two children aged one year old and nine years old. She wants to give her children a good education to the university level. She runs a grocery store in a busy shopping centre. She has been in this business for three years now. She has no other source of income. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the high cost of goods. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to increase her stock of onions. Her future hope is to own a bigger grocery store. She describes herself as very honest and outgoing.

loans.use: To buy more onions

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He is trying to do his best to satisfy his family needs, especially with the heavy demands of life. He has been working as a farmer since 2004 using large plastic tents to grow his products. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the necessary tools and supplies in order to build and install a new plastic tent on his land. He notes that this loan will boost his business productivity and thus his profits. In the future, he’s looking to invest in new land. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies to install a new plastic tent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Alphas

texts.en:
Alphas is a 28-year-old married man. He and his wife Cemorine are blessed with four children between six and one year old. Two of the children are currently enrolled in school. Alphas has operated a boda boda (motorbike) business for the past two years. His primary customers are local residents and tourists. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food. He rents a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Alphas will use the KES 15,000 loan to repair his motorbike and purchase spare parts. Alphas aspires to purchase more motorbikes in the future. He joined Yehu because they offer favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.ru:
Khayala rodilas v 31 qod. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Khayala yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona preselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Khayala is 31 years old, married and has one child.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with her family in the Fuzuli region.  Khayala currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for two years.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He’s really ambitious and looking for a good future. In 2004, he started to work as a farmer on his own land. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will certainly increase his production and therefore enhance his way of living.
