He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase by 10%.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en Douanes. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 07 ans et le dernier a 1an et demi.  
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2007.  Elle sert ses clients de façon ambulante après achat à LOME. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le fait de marcher pour vendre.
Akouavi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums. Elle veut avec les profits réalisés avoir un étalage.
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait ouvrir une boutique pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle aimerait subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a 30 year old woman. She is married to a customs broker. She has 3 children, 2 attend school. The first is aged 7 and the last is aged 18 months.
Akouavi has worked as a cosmetics reseller since 2007.She serves her customers as a mobile saleswoman having purchased her wares in Lomé. At present her principal difficulty is the fact that she has to walk in order to sell.
Akouavi   has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase perfumes. With the profits she hopes to be able to afford a stall.
In the next few years Akouavi   would like to open a boutique which would enable her to  better satisfy her customers’ demands. She says that with the profits, she would like to support her family

loans.use: to purchase perfumes.

loans.name: Munanie

texts.en:
Munanie is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She has operated a curio shop at a tourist market in Malindi for the last five years, with a monthly profit of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy beaded necklaces, wooden carvings of different animals, bracelets, baskets and sandals for sale.

The anticipated profits will be used to meet the basic needs of her family. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy beaded necklaces, wooden carvings of different animals, bracelets, baskets and sandals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 27-year-old married mother of two children, a five-year-old, who is currently enrolled in school, and a six-month-old. Josephine’s husband works as a driver, while she has been selling charcoal and eggs door-to-door for the past six months, her primary customers being neighbors and local residents.

Transportation costs are Josephine's greatest business challenge, while school fees are her highest monthly expense. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Josephine is requesting a Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business. Having joined Yehu because of their great customer service, she aspires to open a cereal business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.ru: Nazima zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetysa IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas proojivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Nazima is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with her husband and children in the Fuzuli region.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for seven years.  Nazima learned this business from her mother.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 56 ans. Elle est veuve et n’a pas d’enfants.
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de bouillie (une nourriture faite à base de mais)  depuis 2001. Elle sert ses clients à la maison et vend seule. Akouavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs et du sucre. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait élargir  en ajoutant d’autres activités. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 56-year-old woman. She is a widow and doesn't have any children. Akouavi works selling bouillie (a type of corn porridge). She has been in this business since 2001. She serves her customers from her home and makes her sales alone Akouavi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy corn and sugar. She would like to re-invest in her business. Over the coming years, Akouavi would like to expand, adding other activities. She says that she plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more water by the sack and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the quality of his work by purchasing new a carpentry kit.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is applying for another loan to start a new cafe business. She will use this 70,000 KES loan to purchase new sofas, plates and other items for the cafe. In the future, Jennifer hopes to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Jennifer has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase new sofas, plates and other items for the cafe.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 33 years old, married, and has one child. He has been hawking assorted items such as biscuits, small mirrors, belts, vests, and hair combs for the last four years. His monthly profit is 8,000 KES.  

Johnson is requesting his first loan for 21,000 KES, which he use to buy biscuits, small mirrors, belts, vests, hair combs for sale. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  

Johnson will use the profits to meet the basic needs of his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and establish a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase  biscuits, small mirrors, belts, vests, and hair combs.

loans.name: Mbogo Yiff Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Mbogo Yiff qui signifie partager la même idéologie a été crée depuis la création du Banc villageois.
Il est composé de 10 femmes.
Madame Adama debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée mére de 10 enfants.

Elle fait une activité de commerce de détails. Avec son nouveau Prét de 75000 francs cfa elle va se payer  du sucre du lait du riz de l'huile des bougies des pilles et des oignons destinés à la revente.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son activité qu elle mène depuis longtemps.

Avec les  bénéfices qu elle va faire elle va payer les frais de scolarisations de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mbogo Yiff' which means 'to share the same ideology'.  It was formed after the village bank was created.  The group is made up of 10 women.

Adama is standing on the right of the photo, raising her hand.  She is the group's leader.  She is 57 years old, married, and has ten children.

Adama's business is selling products retail.  She will use her new loan for 75,000 francs to buy sugar, milk, rice, oil, candles, batteries and onions for resale.  She has good experience in her business which she has run for a long time.

With the profits that she makes, Adama will pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, candles, batteries and onions for resale

loans.name: Boris

texts.fr:
Boris est  un homme âgé  de 32 ans. Il est marié å une infirmière. Il a 02 enfants. Le premier a 04 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Boris travaille comme couturier depuis 1999. Il coud les habits des clients dans un atelier.
Boris a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus jeans pour confection de tenues. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Boris voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Boris is a 32-year-old man.  He is married to a nurse and has two children.  His eldest child is 4 years old and his youngest is 2.

Boris has been working as a tailor since 1999.  He sews clothes for his customers in a workshop.

Boris has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy denim for making clothing.  He would like to re-invest in his business.

Over the coming years, Boris would like to expand his business.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy denim for making clothing

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy and her husband Nicodemus are blessed with 4 children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  For the past 6 years, Lucy has operated a pub whose primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as the transportation of supplies, and her highest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

Lucy will use her KES 20,000 loan to purchase supplies for her pub. She aspires to open a large restaurant and nightclub in the future. She joined Yehu to easily access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large numbers of chickens for sale.

loans.name: Sop Amy Diouf Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe qui porte le nom Sope Amy a été crée depuis l ouverture du Banc Villageois et il est composé de 10 membres habitant le même village.

Madame Sagar est la présidente du groupe elle est mariée et agée de 34 ans mère de 10 enfants. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite de la photo (elle  a la main levée)
 
Elle pratique le commerce avec la vente de produits divers. Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité qu elle pratique depuis longtemps.  

Grace a ses bénéfices Sagar va acheter des denrées alimentaire pour ses enfants. Elle va aussi soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
This group is called Sop Amy and was formed after the opening of the village bank.  It has ten members who live in the same village.

Sagar is the group's president.  She is 34 years old, married, and has ten children.  She is standing on the far right of the photo and has her hand raised.

Sagar sells a range of products.  She has good experience in her business which she has been working in for a long time.

With her profits, Sagar will buy food for her children.  She will also support her husband in covering their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with 4 school-going children. Her husband is an accountant who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Christine has operated a curio shop for the past 2 years; her potential clients are tourists and the locals around her shop. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; there are low sales in some months. She dreams of exporting her products in the future.  With her KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase more curios and renovate her stand. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more curios and renovate her stand.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is 39 years old and a single mother of one child who is 10 years old. She sells second-hand clothes by hawking. She has been in the business for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,000 from the business.

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase clothes for resale.

She will expand her business and support her family with the anticipated profit. Her dream is to have a stable income-generating business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is 29, married, and has two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. She is looking to improve her family’s living conditions at home, and she wants to purchase new home furnishings such as living room furniture, a kitchen table, etc. She does not have enough money for this, so she needs a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. Samar is a conservative woman, so her husband Hamed is photographed instead in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To purchase new home furnishings.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en: Peterson is a single man with no children yet. He runs a general store in a slum area located where he lives. He sells such items as sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages and other items. He has been doing this business for five years now. He says the business is good and the only major challenge he has is the high prices of commodities. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He hopes to grow his business to wholesale. In the future, his dream is to purchase a plot of land on which he will build a residential house. Peterson describes himself as honest and patient.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Biyabu

texts.en:
Biyabu is applying for another loan to expand her rental house. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase iron sheets and pay the laborers for their services. In the future, Biyabu aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Biyabu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to pay for the necessary materials and labor to expand her rental house.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is 40 years old, and is married, but has no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is looking to dispose of his old home furnishings and purchase new ones, such as bedroom furniture, living room furniture, etc. He does not have enough money for this, so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.  His new home furniture will change Murad’s family’s life for the better, and enable him to improve his family’s living conditions. He is pictured in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 44-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Sabah is trading clothes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Sabah is looking to expand her business scale so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Sabah's brother.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29-years-old, married and has two children. He lives with three family members; two of them work.

Ahmad has been the owner of a photography shop since 2008. He gained sufficient experience in this field from his father. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is applying for another loan to expand her water selling business. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase another water tank and pay for the piping services. In the future, Halima aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Halima has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase another water tank and pay for the piping services.

loans.name: Takku  Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de dix sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont parentes et amies; une parfaite solidarité règne entre elles. Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Fama est âgée de 23 ans, mariée elle est mère de trois enfants; elle mène une activité de commerce d'articles divers; elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 3 ans.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en marron.
Elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes et revend au village où elle a ses clients.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants( scolarisation et santé)pour une partie.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on August 28, 2009. It consists of seventeen women who live in the same neighbourhood. They know one another through ties of friendship and kinship, and they share a perfect bond of solidarity. Their main activity is small trade.

The head of the group is Mrs. Fama, standing at the far right in the photo and dressed in brown. She is 23 years old and married with three children. She runs a business selling miscellaneous items, and she has over three years of experience in this activity.

She buys her stock in large cities for resale in the village where she has a customer base. She wants to use her loan to stock up on merchandise and bolster her business to increase her revenue.

She plans to use her profits to help her husband to support the family. A portion will be used to provide for the children’s needs with respect to education and healthcare.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for resale

loans.name: Wafa'a

texts.en:
Wafa'a is a 23-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Wafa'a is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Wafa'a is looking to improve her business and open a shop for selling clothes.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Wafa'a husband.

loans.use: to puchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is applying for another loan to expand her clothes-selling business. She will use this 100,000 KES loan to purchase more clothes and cosmetics for resale. In the future, Jane aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Jane has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Lowenda

texts.en: Lowenda is a 43-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Lowenda is looking to change her old home furniture and purchase new items such as living room seats, dining room furniture, and bedroom furniture, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. She needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Lowenda gets the loan, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and offer her family comfortable home living conditions. Lowenda is a conservative woman, so her husband Mahmoud is shown in the photograph instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture and improve her family's life.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children.

Since 2000, Mohamad has been an owner of a food market that sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs. He wants to earn more profit in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Aïda Thiam Fonk Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Fonk Liggey du banc villageois de Yaral  est créé le 05/10/11. Il est constitué de 15 femmes. Le commerce est leur principale activité. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les membres.

La présidente du groupe,Palla, âgée de 30 ans, est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait du commerce et vend des denrées de première nécessite (riz, niébé, arachide, maïs, etc. Elle se ravitaille au marché de de sa localité ou dans les villes les plus proches dés fois. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu-saumon et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter du niébé, du riz, de l'arachide, du maïs etc. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait acheter un terrain pour ses enfants et les soutenir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Group Fonk Liggey, which depends from the Yaral "banc villageois" (village lending group), was created on 10/05/11. It is constituted of 15 women. Their main activity is retail. The members are in perfect solidarity with one another.

The group’s president, Palla, is 30 years old. She is a widow and a mother of three. Trade is her business, and she retails first-necessity goods (rice, cowpeas, peanuts, corn, etc). She gets her supplies from the market in Gouye Mbeut or sometimes from closer cities. She has been in this business for over ten years and is quite experimented. On the photo, she is standing on the right and is dressed in blue and salmon. She is raising her left hand. With her loan she would like to buy cowpeas, rice, peanuts, corn, etc.

With her loan, she would like to purchase black-eyed peas. With the profit, she would like to buy a parcel for her children and to help them attend school.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Basemah

texts.en:
Basemah is a 45-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Basemah is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

An aspiration of Basemah's is to open another branch of her business.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Basemah's son.

loans.use: to puchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Nassif

texts.en:
Nassif is from Iraq. He is 42 years old and married with three children.

Nassif is a tailor.  He has owned a workshop since 2000 and professionally makes, repairs, and alters clothing including suits, coats and trousers for both women and men. He has more than ten years of experience in the field and a deep understanding of the needs of his local customers. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Nassif decided to apply for a loan of $2,400 in order to purchase a sewing machine and a generator. He aims to increase his profits and improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Khady Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Khady est consolidé le 5 octobre 2011 date d'inauguration du banc villageois; il est composé de quinze femmes issues de la même concession et liées par une forte solidarité. Le commerce constitue leur activité principale.

La responsable Faty (. est âgée de  35 ans , elle est mariée mère de deux enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de niébé et autres produits alimentaires telles du mil et du maïs, elle a une bonne expérience de 2 ans. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu teinté vert-orange.

Elle achéte ses produits (niébé, mil et maïs) au marché central de la ville et revend dans son village où elle a des clients.

Elle souhaite acheter une bonne quantité de produits pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte augmenter son épargne afin de pouvoir gagner plus et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et aussi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Khady was consolidated on October 5, 2011, on the same day that the "banc villageois" (village lending group) was inaugurated. It is composed of fifteen women, who all come from the same concession and are bound by a strong solidarity. Retail is their main activity.

Their leader Faty (. is 35 years old. She is married and a mother of two. Her business is the retail of black-eyed peas and other food products. She has a good experience of two years. She is standing all the way to the right in the picture, dressed in green- and orange-dyed clothes.

She purchases her products from the city’s central market and retails in her village, where she has clients.

She would like to purchase a good quantity of products to increase her revenues. She is planning to increase her savings so she can earn more to help her husband with the family’s expenses and also to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase black-eyed peas, millet and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beaded necklaces, bracelets, baskets, sandals, and wooden carvings of animals.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 44-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Hanan is looking to open a shop for her business near her home to increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, also helps provide for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Amina has operated a clothes business for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a challenge of seasonality: in some months there are low sales. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou est créé le 27 août 2009, il est composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont amies, parentes et sont en parfaite entente.


Madame Penda la responsable est âgée de 36 ans, c'est une femme divorcée mère d'un enfant; elle s'active dans le micro-jardinage et l'embouche; elle fait parallèlement du commerce de chaussures et perles.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en tee shirt et pagne jaune.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du matériel agricole( des intrants entre autres.....) et des moutons pour l'embouche.


La scolarité de son fils et la santé de sa famille sont au centre de ses préoccupations, c'est pour cela qu'elle compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour eux.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on August 27, 2009. It is composed of twelve women who reside in the same district. They are friends and relatives and they all get along perfectly.

The leader Mrs. Penda is 36 years old; she is divorced and a mother of one. She is active in micro-gardening and cattle fattening. In parallel, she also retails pearls and shoes. She is standing all the way to the right, dressed in a yellow tee-shirt and wrap.

With her loan, she would like to purchase farming material (among others, agricultural intrants) and sheep to fatten.

She is mostly preoccupied with her son going to school and with the health of her family; this is why she is planning on using her profit for them.

loans.use: to buy farming material and sheep.

loans.name: Muhanad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has three children.

Muhanad has been an owner of a mobile phone shop since 2000, selling mobile phones and accessories. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to paint his shop’s walls and to make more shelves. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: To paint his shop’s walls and to make more shelves.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old married to Peter and they are blessed with four children and she is supporting only one child.

Mary supplies water pipes and also mobile phones in the Nairobi region. She has been in this business for the last year and has an income of KES10,000 per month. Mary is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy more water pipes.

She will use the extra profit to expand her business and educate her child. Mary hopes to set up her own hardware. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more water pipes.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 22-year-old single man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Hisham has an auto repair and accessories shop. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JD to purchase vehicle accessories.

Hisham is looking at building his own house.

loans.use: to purchase auto accessories

loans.name: Ndiaga  Adj Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Ndiaga Adj est créé le 5 octobre 2011, il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont amies, parentes et sont en parfaite entente.


Madame Assy la responsable est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée mère de sept enfants; elle s'active dans le commerce d'alimentation; elle possède une boutique à domicile.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en en rouge.

Elle achète ses produits(riz, sucre, huile, oignons, poivre....) dans la ville et dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son commerce pour pouvoir se faire beaucoup de bénéfices.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices épargner un montant consistant qui lui permettra de gérer les besoins de ses enfants et pouvoir même acheter des moutons et chèvres pour constituer un cheptel et revendre de temps en temps.
texts.en:
The 'Ndiaga Adj' community bank was formed on October 5th, 2011.  It has fifteen [female] members who live in the same neighborhood.  They are friends and relations and they live in perfect harmony.

Assy, the group's leader, is 51 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She sells food and has a store in her home.  She is standing on the far right in the photo, dressed in red.

Assy buys her products (rice, sugar, oil, onions, pepper...) in town and in the weekly markets.  She re-sells these products in her village.

Assy hopes to use her loan to strengthen her business so that she can make a lot of profits.

Assy plans to use her profits to save a consistent sum which will allow her to manage her children's needs and be able to buy sheep and goats to have livestock to resell from time to time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children. One is enrolled in school while the other is still too young. Her husband is a taxi driver who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

Margaret has operated as a food vendor for the past six years. She sells her products out of her house. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a challenge of fluctuating commodities prices in the market. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance for financial assistance to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anta   Mbaye  Thiam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Anta est consolidé le 5 octobre 2011 date d'inauguration du banc villageois; il est composé de douze femmes issues de la même concession et liées par une forte solidarité. Le commerce constitue leur activité principale.

La responsable Fatou est âgée de 40 ans , elle est mariée mère de sept enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de niébé et autres produits alimentaires, elle a une bonne expérience de 2 ans;elle fais aussi de la couture. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu multicolore et a mis les mains sur les hanches.

Elle achéte ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans son village.

Elle souhaite acheter une bonne quantité de produits pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte augmenter son épargne afin de pouvoir aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille, subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et acheter un terrain pour eux.
texts.en:
The Anta community bank was formed on October 5th, 2011, the date their village bank was created.  The group has 12 female members who are from the same area and linked by a strong sense of solidarity.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Fatou is the group's leader.  She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.  She has a business selling cowpeas and other foodstuffs.  She has a good two years experience and also sews for a living.  She is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in a multi-colored dress, and has her hands on her hips.

Fatou buys her products in large quantities in order to make more income.

Fatou plans to increase her savings in order to help her husband with their family expenses.  She would also like to meet her children's needs and buy a plot of land for them.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s floor and ceiling and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 40-year-old man from Baqa'a, Jordan.

Mustafa is a blacksmith and he is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase machines and other materials.

Mustafa is looking to open another branch for his blacksmith shop so that he can employ his sons at it.

loans.use: to purchase machines and materilas

loans.name: Madin

texts.en: Madin is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and two siblings. Madin supports his family financially and does not hesitate to give them help whenever they need it. He has been involved in agriculture for the past eight years. In 2006, he started to work independently on his own land growing vegetables. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase agriculturA. supplies. In the future, he plans to expand his business and he is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantiA. growth in the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase needed agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Naby est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Boury est âgée de 41 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants ; elle mène une activité de restauration, elle a une bonne expérience de plus de trois ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou orange-vert avec un châle vert et a levé la main droite.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché central et revend sur place où elle a un restaurant.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du riz, huile,sucre, lait, des condiments et autres produits pour le petit déjeuner en grande quantité afin de se faire plus de revenus à la vente.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille pour la scolarité, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby group was created August 28, 2009. It is made up of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood; they are neighbors. Small trade is their main activity.

The leader, Mrs. Boury, is a 41-year-old mother of five. She is in food service, in which she has more than three years of experience. She is standing at the right of the picture wearing an orange-green boubou with a green shawl and raising her right hand. 

She stocks up at the central market and resells at her restaurant.

She would like to use her loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, condiments, and other products for breakfast in bulk in order to be able to make more money when she sells it.

She plans to use her earnings to help her husband with the family expenses, including for school, health expenses, and food.

loans.use: to buy food products for food service

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Nogaye est âgée de 51 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants ; elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus, de pagnes et autres articles; elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou marron-noir et couverte d'un châle rose.
Elle s'approvisionne dans la capitale et revend au marché central.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aiD. son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille pour la scolarité, la santé et la nourriture; aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was created August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

The group manager is Ms. Nogaye who is 51 years old, married and a mother of five children. Her business activity is trading in fabrics, pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and other items. She has an accumulated 10 years of experience in her area. She is standing on the right in the picture, dressed in a brown-black robe and covered with a pink shawl. She gets her supplies from the capital and resells them in the central market.

She wants to use her ​​loan to buy large quantities of goods to strengthen her business and increase her income. Her profits will be used to assist her husband in dealing with the family's education, health and food expenditures. She also intends to increase her savings level.

loans.use: Buy goods for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanakombo has operated a leso (kanga-a wearable cloth) selling business for the past seven years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in that she makes most of her sales in the holiday seasons. She aspires to open a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more lesos for resale. She decided join Yehu Microfinance to gain financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more lesos for resale.

loans.name: And Jëff Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Jëff est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier,elles sont voisines.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Siga est âgée de 41 ans, mariée elle a dix enfants en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de tissus, de pagnes et autres articles; elle a une bonne expérience de plusieurs années .Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en tenu rose.
Elle s'approvisionne dans les grandes villes et revend au village.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et à l'avenir acheter un terrain pour ses enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The And Jëff solidarity group was created August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

The group responsible is Mrs. Siga. Age 41, she is married with ten children under her care. Her business activity is trading in fabrics, pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) and other items, and has gained solid experience over several years.

She is standing on the right in the picture, dressed in light pink. She gets her supplies from large cities and resells them in the village.

Her ​​loan will serve to buy goods in large quantities to strengthen her business and obtain more revenue. Her profits will be used to assist her husband in dealing with household expenditures. In the future she wants to acquire a plot of land for her children and also increase her savings level.

loans.use: Buy goods for retail sales

loans.name: Sop  Serigne  Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Bara est créé le 28 août 2009, il est constitué de quinze de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et vivent en parfaite harmonie.Le petit commerce est leur principale activité.

La responsable madame Maguette est âgée de 49 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants, et a quatre orphelins de père et de mère en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de fruits de saison. Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de douze ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou orange-vert avec un châle vert et a levé la main droite.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché et revend sur place où elle a une table.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des fruits, en grande quantité afin de se faire plus de revenus à la vente.

Elle compte avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et assurer l'habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Bara was created on August 28, 2009. It consists of fifteen women from the same neighborhood who live in perfect harmony. Their main activity is small trade.

The leader of the group is Mrs. Maguette, seen standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, and wearing a green and orange dress with a green scarf. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She also takes care of four orphans. 

Mrs. Maguette sells seasonal fruit and has over twelve years of experience in this activity. She buys her stock at the market for resale on site where she has a booth.

She will use her loan to stock up on large quantities of fruit in order to increase her sales and revenue.

The profits will be used to help her husband to support the family and provide for the children’s clothing needs.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit for resale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 33-year-old married man.

Hussein has been the owner of a shop since 2009, selling construction materials. He has a sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent  and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 40 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children aged 18 to 5 years old; all of her children are presently in school and live at home. For the past  seven years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. She makes lots of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal  for her business.

loans.name: Bousso Dieng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bousso  du banc villageois de Yaral  est créé le 05/10/11. Il est composé de 13 femmes. Elles sont des amies de longue date et y a une forte solidarité entre elles.

La présidente du groupe Marame est une femme de 37 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants et une nièce en sa charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. De temps en temps elle fait du commerce de denrées de première nécessité. Elle se ravitaille en mouton au marché hebdomadaire de Gouye Mbeut. Elle mène cette activité depuis 05 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu teinté rayé de couleur verte.

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter des marchandises et des sujets pour embouche.

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait gérer les besoins de ses enfants et aider son mari dans le quotidien.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bousso of the Banc Villageois of Yaral was created on October 5, 2011. It is comprised of thirteen women who have been friends for a long time, and thus, solidarity is strong between them. 

The group's president, Marame, is a 37-year-old married woman who has four children and a niece to support. 

Her work involves fattening cattle. From time to time, she does commerce in staple goods. She resupplies herself with sheep at the weekly market of Gouye Mbeut. She has been in this business for five years. Marame is the one in the photo standing at the right and dressed in green stripes. 

With her loan, she would like to buy merchandise and some animals to fatten. 

Marame would like to use the profits to take care of her children and to help out her husband day to day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and and animals to fatten

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 33-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Suhair has a mobile phone shop where she sells mobile phones, prepaid credit cards for mobile phones and some other mobile phone accessories. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase prepaid mobile cards and more mobile phones.

Suhair is looking to redecorate her shop.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Suhair's husband.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid mobile cards and mobile phones.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44-years-old, married and has two children.

Sadek has been the owner of a bakery since 2000, selling bread and pastries. He has more than ten years experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply $2000 loan in order to fix and paint his bakery’s wall and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to fix and paint his bakery’s wall and floor.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is applying for another loan to expand her food stall. She will use this 35,000 Kes loan to purchase ten bags of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her food stall. In the future, Fatuma aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Fatuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her food stall.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents.

Ahmad has been a shop-owner since 2000, selling sports wear and equipments.  He has more than ten years experience in this field and a good reputation.  His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2700 loan in order to paint and renovate his shop’s wall and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint and renovate his shop’s wall and floor.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is a 33-year-old man who got married a few months ago. He lives in A. Mafraq.

Nayef opened his own clothes store five years ago and expanded it through the years to become what it is now. He sells casuA. and formA. men's clothes. Now he has applied for a loan to bring in more products to the store, mainly the winter collection since we are now knocking on winter’s door. With the loan, he will be prepared for the upcoming Eid (Muslin pilgrimage) and holiday seasons.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his clothing store

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has six children.

Sabah is an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there's a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so to be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and father of three children.

Jassem has been an owner of a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to renovate his market, to buy a tricycle truck and to add more foodstuffs to his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his market, to buy a tricycle truck and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and father of one child. He lives with his family and brothers, three of whom work.

Abdallah has owned an electric generator since 2009, leasing electric lines for his area and surrounding areas. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation in his area.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 in order to build a room for generators. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to build a room for generators.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is applying for another loan to expanding her clothing business. She will use this 47,900 Kes loan to purchase clothes, fabric, handbags and shoes for resale. In the future, Margaret aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Margaret has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase clothes, fabric, handbags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 55-year-old retired man who is married and has seven sons and daughters. Two of his sons have gotten married already.

After retirement, Khaled opened a car repair shop for repairing and selling some car parts. At first, it was a little bit challenging since he had no experience in that field. However, to be able to support his family and make his business work, he learned all that he needed in a short time until he is now one of the best-known car repair shops in the area.

Khaled has applied today for a loan in order to add some decoration to the shop and buy products that are missing from his store.

loans.use: to add decoration to his car repair shop and buy more products

loans.name: Mikhael

texts.en: Mikhael is a 56-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children. He has 25 years experience working in the shoe business. He finally decided to have his own shoe factory almost four years ago. He cooperates with his wife who works in a locA. company to gather enough money and be able to pay the high costs of living.  Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, he’s looking to target wider markets.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and rapoko.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en: Mervat is a 35-year-old widow who was left with three children after her husband passed away. To be able to support her kids, Mervat was urged to start a small retail business selling clothes at her house. Since she started, she has been able to manage it in addition to taking care of her kids. Since there is an upcoming opportunity to increase her sales rate (the holidays season plus the winter season), Mervat decided to apply for this loan to buy more clothes so she can be prepared to cover as many of her customers’ needs as she can. Because Mervat is a conservative person, she asked her mother Alia to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is a widowed woman with six children who are all adults. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Meselemani has operated a firewood-selling business for the past 15 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of being a firewood wholesaler.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to be able to access financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Eloy sigue trabajando como maestro de obras y sigue con la venta de materiales de construcción. 

Eloy con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Eloy requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo arena, cemento, pintura, madera, clavos, focos y otras cosas más.
 
Eloy se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eloy is a member of the Inti Pakareq, a community bank associated with Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco.  He has a construction business.  

Eloy contracts for construction projects and sells building materials.  Funding from the bank helped Eloy's business before, so he's applying for another loan now.  

Eloy will use the loan to buy building materials such as sand, cement, pain, timber, nails and other products that he will resell.

Eloy is grateful for the opportunities your lending provides and is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials, clothing and vegetables.

loans.name: Yola

texts.en: Yola is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She established a tailoring business at her home in 1997. She makes and repairs clothes. Her income is vitA. to support her family and to be able to pay for the high expenses of life. She works hard to support the family, in collaboration with her husband, who works in a locA. financiA. company. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new sewing machines. She hopes to increase her productivity, and thus her sales and her income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for their retail businesses.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is applying for another loan to expand her shop. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for resale. In the future, Hanna aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Hanna has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana Alexandra tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza está conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.
Diana se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya, cacao, plátano las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos para la maleza para los cultivos.
Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara  y aumentará la producción agrícola para obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño es llegar a tener una finca y animales.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta diariamente es la competencia entre comerciantes, vías de comunicación.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar y disfrutar de los carnavales del sector.
texts.en:
Diana Alexandra, 19, is single.  She has no children and lives with her parents in Chillanes, a town in Bolivar province.
The Vuelve la Esperanza community bank has 13 members.  It is located in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, some 60 minutes from our office.
Diana Alexandra has a farming business.  She grows maize, soybeans, cacao and platanos.  She buys and sells the supplies she needs, every weekend, at San Jose del Tambo.
Diana Alexandra will use this loan to buy seed, fertilizers, organic manure, weed killer and other supplies.
The loan will help her to increase her output and, in turn, her income.
Diana Alexandra's long-term goal is to have a farm and live-stock business of her own.
The main challenges she faces are stiff competition from other farmers and the roads to market.
In her free time, Diana Alexandra likes to take walks and go to local carnivals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Ruth Julieta

texts.es:
Ruth sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Ruth sigue dedicándose confección de ropa en maquina de tejer.

Ruth con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Ruth requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de costura como por ejemplo hilos, telas y otras cosas más. 

Ruth se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ruth continues to participate in the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank, affiliated with the Microfinance Unit of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. Ruth is still dedicated to making clothing with a sewing machine.

Things went very well with Ruth's last loan and she was able to obtain good benefits. With this motive in mind, she desires another loan that will help her a great deal. Ruth needs the loan to buy sewing materials including thread, cloth, and many other items.

Ruth is very grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and in addition, she promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like thread, fabric and many other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is a 40-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one sibling. She has owned a clothing shop since 2002. She sells only women's clothes. With her business income, she is able to support her father with the family expenses. Today, she’s asking to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the new winter clothes collections. She notes that women are very trendy and these new clothes will help her increase her sales by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to also sell men's and children's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter clothes collections

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en:
Mayada is a 37-year-old Lebanese single woman living with one parent and two siblings. She has been working as a beauty specialist for the past four years. In parallel, she also works as a hairdresser. She works from her home and she also serves clients at their domiciles. She has a good business reputation and has a good number of customers asking for her services.

Today, she’s asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a car for her business. She states that this car will help with her transportation, especially since her customers are located in different areas and villages. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rope and silk thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr:
Kossiwavi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent au port. Elle a 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier a 10ans et le dernier a 03 ans.
Kossiwavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits vestimentaires depuis 1an. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle répond à la demande de ses clients.
Kossiwavi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits vestimentaires. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossiwavi voudrait développer l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossiwavi is a 35-year-old woman who is married to a harbor officer. She has three children, two of whom go to school. The oldest child is 10 years old, and the youngest is 3. 

Kossiwavi has been selling apparel for the past year. She has a shop where she caters to her customers’ needs. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to purchase clothing and reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Kossiwavi would like to expand her business. She will use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy apparel for resale

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He has been working as a furniture upholsterer for the past 10 years, and today he is the proud owner of a furniture upholstery business. He works hard to meet his family's needs. 

He’s asking for a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. He notes that these purchases will help him improve his work and increase his revenue. In the future, he plans to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: José Andres

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los ocho años de edad, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar junto con sus hermanos. Él proviene de una familia numerosa son cinco hermanos, los cuales a lo largo de su vida enfrentaron grandes carencias, por la pobreza de ese tiempo, les toco comer con tortilla mojada con suero y sal. Pero que la misma necesidad los hacia conforme y felices.

Poco a poco fueron trabajando y todos sus hermanos tienen sus hogares, y José esta feliz de tener una familia a la cual le brinda lo necesario para subsistir. Él ha sembrado una milpa cerca de su casa y dice que no fue mucho lo que perdió con el invierno, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la recolección del maíz y fríjol, ya que necesita pagar empleados, para que le ayuden a esa actividad. También quiere comprar una vaca. Una parte de la producción la venderá y el resto lo dejara para consumo de su hogar. José piensa en sembrar la milpa del próximo año con lo que ingrese de la venta del maíz de este año.

José desea brindarle a su familia el sustento diario y comprar un terreno más grande, para sembrar un poco más.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 35 years old and lives with his life companion. They have one child. José has been farming for eight years. His parents taught him and his siblings how to work. He comes from a family with five children, so he knows what it is like to lack many things in life as a result of poverty. Sometimes the only food available to eat was tortillas dipped in whey and salt, but his family was able to adapt and remain happy.

José and his siblings worked over time and all of them have their own homes. He is very happy that he has a family for whom he can provide the necessities for living. José has a cornfield near his house and says he did not lose much during the winter. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can harvest corn and beans. He needs to pay workers to help with this activity. José also wants to buy a cow. Part of the milk that it produces will be sold and the rest will be reserved for household consumption.

José plans to plant corn next year, so he will reinvest the income from this year’s sales. He wants to provide for his family’s daily sustenance and buy a larger piece of land so that he can plant a few more crops.

loans.use: to pay workers to help with harvesting and to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es:
A sus 18 años de edad Jhon sueña con poder generar mayores ingresos para poder estudiar en la universidad y tener un mejor futuro, y así más adelante poder pensar en tener su propio hogar.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, café, aguacates, frutas y minutos de celular en un pequeño puesto de venta ambulante. Con el crédito quiere comprar un carrito que le permita mejorar su venta al publico.
texts.en:
Jhon is only 18 years old, but he has big dreams.  He wants to make enough money to go to college, establish a career and one day have a home of his own.  

Jhon works as a street vendor, selling coffee, avocados, fruits and cell-phone minutes, from a small cart that he owns.  He will use this loan to buy a larger cart so that he can sell more.

loans.use: to buy a larger food cart for his retail business.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 01 enfant de 4ans qui va à l’école.
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse de maïs et divers depuis 2001. Elle vend à toutes personnes dans sa maison et ne rencontre  aucune difficulté.
Dédé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité
Dans les prochaines années, Dédé voudrait élargir en vendant d’autres produits. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dédé is a thirty-nine year old woman. She is married to a retailer. She has one child who is four years old and goes to school.
Dédé has worked as a retailer of corn and miscellaneous items since 2001. She sells to everyone in her home and doesn't run into any difficulties. 
Dédé requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy corn. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Dédé would like to enlarge her business by selling other products. She says that with the profits she anticipates taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. This young man decided in 2010 to start his own business working as a furniture painter. He has had 8 years of previous experience working in this domain. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools in order to accomplish his work properly. He hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth and increased sales.

loans.use: to renew his business tools in order to accomplish his work properly.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bokk Jom a été crée depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois . Il est composé de 13 membres qui habitent le même village. 

Madame Mame Gnilane debout à l'extrème droit sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. elle est agée de 21 ans elle est mariée et  mère de 2 enfants. elle s'active dans la vente de produits divers activité qu elle maîtrise bien pour l avoir pratiquer depuis longtemps. 

Avec les bénéfices de son activité elle va désormais participer a la dépense quotidienne et acheter des habits à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom group was created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of thirteen members who live in the same village.
Ms. Mame Gnilane, who is standing up and raising her hand at the far right of the photo, is the leader of the group. She is twenty-one years old, married, and the mother of two children. She works in sales of various products, an activity that she handles well because she has practiced it for a long time. 
With the gains from her business she will from now on participate in everyday spending and buy her children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish, sets of jewelry, and pigs.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco Tulio tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la aldea de La Pimienta. Lleva 10 años de casado con su esposa Mirna y tienen una hija de 8 años de edad. La señora Mirna es ama de casa y el señor Marco tiene un taller de venta de llantas y reparación. 

El taller está ubicado en el patio de su casa. Allí el señor Marco vende llantas nuevas y usadas. También ofrece servicios de cambio de llantas, pintura de carros y reparación de los golpes en los carros accidentados. El taller está abierta 9 horas al día, de lunes a sábado. 

El señor Marco pasó 8 años fuera del país. Durante este tiempo ahorró para poder regresar a Honduras y estar cerca a su familia con el fin de poner su propio negocio. Este es el primer crédito que ha solicitado el señor Marco y lo va a utilizar en la compra de llantas para surtir el taller. Su esperanza es que en un futuro próximo, logrará ser dueño propio de su casa.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 38 years old, and he lives in the village of La Pimienta.  He has been married to his wife, Mirna, for ten years; and they have an eight year old daughter.  Mirna is a housewife, and Marco has a tire sales and repair shop.

The shop is located on the patio of his house.  That is where Marco sells new and used tires.  He also offers services to change tires, paint cars, and repair damage from accidents.  His shop is open nine hours a day from Monday through Saturday.

Marco spent eight years outside of the country.  During this time he saved in order to be able to return to Honduras to be close to his family and establish his own business.

This is the first loan that Marco has requested.  He will use it to buy tires to stock his shop.  His hope for the near future is to manage to be the owner of his own house.

loans.use: to buy new and used tires.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one school-aged child. He has owned a car repair shop since 1999. His job consists of repairing vehicle bodies. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. He cooperates with his wife who works in selling shoes and electrical products in order to pay the whole family expenses, especially their child's educational fees. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car spare parts. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store and trade in spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase more car spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onion, and coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Maria Debora

texts.es:
A los 55 años de edad Maria Debora ha visto crecer a sus 9 hijos, y a la ves, golpeada por la pobreza a visto como uno de ellos se pierde en las drogas. Así las cosas ella anhela poderle dar educación a sus 3 hijos menores, ya que quiere verlos salir adelante!

Sus ingresos provienen del cultivo y venta de tomates, actividad que alterna con la venta de reciclaje. Con el crédito solicitado busca mejorar la irrigación de su cultivo.

Da gracias a Dios por permitirle acceder al crédito y mejorar las condiciones para realizar su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
At 55 years of age, Maria Debora has seen her 9 children grow up, and at the same time, beaten down by poverty, she has seen one of them lost to drugs. With things as they are, she hopes to be able to offer an education to her 3 youngest children, because she wants to see them get ahead!

Her income depends upon growing and selling tomatoes, an activity she alternates with selling recycled items. With her solicited loan, she hopes to improve the irrigation of her crop.

She gives thanks to God for allowing her access to credit and a chance to improve conditions for carrying out her productive activity.

loans.use: to improve the irrigation of her tomato field.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age vraie entre 12 et 21 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce il y'a de cela 20 ans. elle vend des vêtements pour adultes, enfants , des bijoux fantaisies de toutes les marques en or plaques et en argent.Ses ventes ont largement augmentes et elle a rembourse ses differents cycles de prets avec succes et a fait des epargnes considerables.

avec ce nouveau prêt , a la veille des festivités de fin d'année, elle va aller s'approvisionner, renouveler le stock de ses habits  des enfants filles comme garçons, des bijoux , des tenues de cérémonies, et des robes de mariées et tous ce dont intéressent les clients.

Tres entreprenante, elle tient de ouvrir un magasin des habits prêts a porter et se lancer aussi dans la vente de carton de poissons sales en gros et des bidons d'huile végétale.Comme bonne mère de famille, elle s'occupe bien de ses enfants et de leur éducation.
texts.en:
The client is forty-eight years old, single with two children whose ages are between twelve and twenty-one years, and she launched her business twenty years ago. She sells clothing for adults and children, and all brands of gold-plated and silver costume jewelry. Her sales have increased considerably and she has reimbursed her various loan cycles with success and has saved considerably.

With this new loan, on the eve of the end of the year festivals, she will stock up and renew her clothing stock: children's clothes for girls and boys, jewelry, suits for ceremonies, wedding dresses, and everything that interests her clients.

Very enterprising, she just opened a ready to wear clothing shop and launched a business selling boxes of salted fish wholesale, and cans of vegetable oil. As a good mother of her family, she takes good care of her children and their education.

loans.use: to boost her business by buying children's clothes.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta is 48 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has five children aged 10 to 20 years old. For the past ten years, she been selling  candy and biscuits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business. She likes her business because of the way she exchanges money and it also helps her to feed her children. Her plans is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more candy and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Exequiel

texts.es:
El señor Oscar tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Los Angela. Es casado y tiene dos hijas, de 4 y 8 años de edad. Su esposa Alba es comerciante y sale a vender mercadería de forma ambulante, 3 veces a la semana. Ella empezó vendiendo mercadería hace 3 años. 

Hace 8 meses, la pareja puso una pulpería donde vende comestibles y granos básicos. Don Oscar vendió su vehículo para poner el negocio porque quería tener un fuente de ingreso fuera de su trabajo actual. Don Oscar sigue trabajando en el taller de camiones de su padre, pero dedica 6 horas diarias a la pulpería. Cuando no está Don Oscar, la señora Alba cuida el negocio y atiende a la clientela. 

El señor Oscar va a utilizar el préstamo de L6500 para comprar granos básicos como maíz y frijol, y mercadería como ropa, calzados y cosméticos, con la esperanza de surtir a la pulpería y a la venta ambulante de su esposa. Oscar espera que en un futuro, cuando la pulpería está suficientemente grande, los dos podrán dedicarse solo a ella.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old, and he lives in the village of Los Angela.  He is married and has two daughters, ages 4 and 8.  His wife, Alba, is a merchant.  She sells merchandise in an itinerant manner three times a week.  She started selling merchandise three years ago.

Eight months ago the couple established a grocery store where food and basic grains are sold.  Oscar sold his vehicle in order to set up this business.  He wanted to have a source of income aside from his current job.  Oscar continues working in his father’s truck workshop.  However, he devotes six hours a day to the grocery store.  When Oscar is not there, Alba takes care of the business and tends to the customers.

Oscar will use the loan for 6,500 lempiras to buy basic grains like corn and beans.  He will also buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to stock his grocery store and his wife’s itinerant sales.

Oscar hopes that in the future, when the grocery store is big enough, the two of them will be able to only work there.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Deiby Alexander

texts.es:
Deiby es un hombre luchador, que busca sacar adelante a su esposa y sus 2 hijas a pesar de la pobreza que ha enmarcado sus vidas.

En búsqueda de ingresos que le permitieran el sostenimiento de su hogar y la educación de sus pequeñas, Deiby monto una chaza en el parque de Nariño, desde la cual vende dulces y minutos a celular.
